If no such vote that satisfies these conditions takes place by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be resolved as NO. It is important to note that simply suggesting or organizing a vote without actually conducting it by the stated deadline does not meet the criteria for a YES determination.

question.title: Will Missouri remove the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Missouri officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. The change must be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement remains in place, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Missouri not remove the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Missouri does not officially announce the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. The change must not be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If such an announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement is removed, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the state of Missouri eliminate the employment mandate from its Medicaid program before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Missouri's government officially declares the elimination of the employment mandate from its Medicaid program. This alteration must be verified through official state communications or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or significant national newspapers). The employment mandate pertains to the stipulation that beneficiaries are required to work or participate in other qualifying activities to qualify for Medicaid benefits. If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the employment mandate remains intact, the inquiry will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Pennsylvania conducts a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024 and (b) Missouri removes the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:
   1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
   2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
   3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
   If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the state of Missouri officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. The change must be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement remains in place, the question resolves as NO.

If both (a) and (b) occur by their respective dates, this question resolves as YES. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Pennsylvania conducts a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024 nor (b) Missouri removes the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:
   1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
   2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
   3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
   If such a referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the state of Missouri officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. The change must be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If such an announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement is removed, the question resolves as NO.

If neither (a) nor (b) occurs by their respective dates, this question resolves as YES. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Pennsylvania will hold a referendum regarding abortion rights before August 2024 and (b) Missouri will eliminate the work requirement from its Medicaid program prior to July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined as YES if both of the subsequent conditions are satisfied:

(a) By August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania holds a public referendum aimed specifically at securing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a YES outcome, the following standards must be fulfilled:
   1. The referendum must be officially declared and executed by the state of Pennsylvania.
   2. The central aim of the referendum must be the protection of abortion rights.
   3. The results of the referendum must be made publicly available through official state channels or prominent news outlets.
   If no such referendum fulfilling these standards occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, the state of Missouri officially declares the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid program. This modification must be validated through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or leading national newspapers). The work requirement pertains to the stipulation that beneficiaries must work or partake in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement continues to be enforced, the question resolves as NO.

If both (a) and (b) transpire by their respective deadlines, this question resolves as YES. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Spotify announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Spotify officially announces further layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The additional layoffs must be clearly separate from and in addition to the initially reported 2% workforce reduction. If no such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, or if Spotify only provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 2% reduction without announcing new cuts, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will Spotify not announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if Spotify does not officially announce further layoffs beyond the initially reported 2% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. The absence of such an announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The lack of additional layoffs must be clearly separate from and in addition to the initially reported 2% workforce reduction. If such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, or if Spotify provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 2% reduction without announcing new cuts, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Spotify will declare further job cuts beyond the previously stated 2% by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if Spotify makes an official declaration of additional job cuts beyond the previously indicated 2% of its staff by August 31, 2024. The confirmation must come from official company announcements or reports from at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The new layoffs must be distinctly separate from and in addition to the previously mentioned 2% workforce reduction. If no further layoffs are announced by the designated date, or if Spotify only shares updates or clarifications regarding the initially reported 2% reduction without revealing new layoffs, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Reserve Bank of India and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the repo rate, which is the RBI's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India not announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India does not publicly announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must not be officially made by the Reserve Bank of India and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must not be in the repo rate, which is the RBI's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be no concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If such an announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India lower its main interest rate before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially declares a decrease in its main interest rate by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be made publicly by the Reserve Bank of India and covered by at least two respected financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The decrease must pertain to the repo rate, which is the RBI's primary mechanism for influencing the economy. A mere suggestion or conjecture regarding potential future rate cuts will not suffice; there must be a definitive announcement of a real rate decrease. If no such declaration occurs by the given date, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will GNC Holdings emerge from bankruptcy by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, GNC Holdings officially emerges from its Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings. The emergence must be confirmed by at least two reputable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) or through official company statements or court documents. The emergence should involve a court-approved reorganization plan that allows GNC Holdings to continue operations with a restructured financial position. If GNC Holdings remains in bankruptcy proceedings, is liquidated, or fails to emerge from bankruptcy by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will GNC Holdings not emerge from bankruptcy by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, GNC Holdings does not officially emerge from its Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings. The emergence must not be confirmed by at least two reputable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) or through official company statements or court documents. The emergence should not involve a court-approved reorganization plan that allows GNC Holdings to continue operations with a restructured financial position. If GNC Holdings emerges from bankruptcy proceedings, is not liquidated, or succeeds in emerging from bankruptcy by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will GNC Holdings successfully exit bankruptcy by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if GNC Holdings officially exits its Chapter 11 bankruptcy by July 31, 2024. The exit should be part of a court-sanctioned reorganization strategy that permits GNC Holdings to operate with a revised financial structure. If GNC Holdings is still in bankruptcy, undergoes liquidation, or does not exit bankruptcy by the given date, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will the Italian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Italian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the Italian economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Italian economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can Italy's economy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Italy's economy does not fall into a recession. A recession is defined for this context as experiencing two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. Conversely, the answer will be NO if Italy's economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, through July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

not_P.title: Will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase not exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase less than or equal to 0.5% in every single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If such an increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

para_P.title: Will there be a monthly rise in the Federal Reserve's favored inflation metric that surpasses 0.5% by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if the Federal Reserve's favored inflation metric (usually the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) indicates a month-over-month rise exceeding 0.5% in any month from October 2023 through July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially reported by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (like the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and covered by at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). If no such rise occurs within this timeframe, the inquiry will be answered with NO. It is important to note that this question is concerned with the month-over-month change, rather than year-over-year or other periods.

question.body: (a) The Italian economy avoids a recession by July 31, 2024, meaning it does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. question.title: Will France appoint a new President by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a new President is officially appointed in France. The appointment must be confirmed by official government announcements or reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). For the purpose of this question, a 'new' President refers to an individual who is not currently serving in this role as of October 1, 2023. If no new President is appointed by the resolution date, or if the current President as of October 1, 2023, remains in office, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will France not appoint a new President by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, no new President is officially appointed in France. para_P.title: Will a new President be selected in France before August 2024?

If a new President is not appointed by the resolution date, or if the existing President as of October 1, 2023, continues in office, the inquiry will be deemed FALSE.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (a) France does not appoint a new President by August 2024, or (b) the Bank of England's base rate is below 5.00% in August 2024?

Confirmation must not come from official Bank of England announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Guardian). para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of these criteria are fulfilled: (a) By August 31, 2024, a new President is officially named in France, with the appointment verified by official government statements or reported by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). A 'new' President is defined as someone who is not currently in this position as of October 1, 2023. If either of these conditions is not satisfied, the outcome will be negative.

question.title: Will the United Kingdom's House of Lords pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If no such bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the United Kingdom's House of Lords not pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
not_P.body:

2. It must not be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must not be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must not be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If a bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed that meets all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

If no such legislation is approved by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a legislation is approved but does not meet all the aforementioned criteria, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Apple finalize a union contract with store employees in Ohio by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Apple has finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Ohio. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Sergey Brin on X by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Sergey Brin on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Sergey Brin must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Elon Musk not conduct a live interview with Sergey Brin on X by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if Elon Musk does not conduct a live interview with Sergey Brin on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The interview must not be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must not be the primary interviewer.
3. Sergey Brin must not be the interviewee.
4. The event must not be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must not be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must not report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If any of these conditions are not met by August 31, 2024, or if the interview does occur, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Elon Musk to have a live discussion with Sergey Brin on X before the end of August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if Elon Musk holds a live discussion with Sergey Brin on X (previously known as Twitter) on or before August 31, 2024. For a favorable outcome, the following conditions must be satisfied:

1. The discussion should take place live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must serve as the main interviewer.
3. Sergey Brin must participate as the interviewee.
4. The event needs to be officially announced by either X or Elon Musk ahead of time.
5. The discussion must be made publicly available on the X platform.
6. A minimum of two prominent news organizations (like CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must cover the event either prior to or following its occurrence.

If all these criteria are fulfilled by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will resolve as YES. If any of these criteria are unmet by that date, or if the discussion does not take place, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the United States implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made electric vehicles by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made electric vehicles. The implementation must be confirmed by official U.S. government announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The New York Times). The tariff must be specifically targeted at electric vehicles manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all vehicles. If no such tariff meeting these criteria is implemented by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the United States not implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made electric vehicles by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States does not officially implement a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made electric vehicles. The absence of such implementation must be confirmed by official U.S. government announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The New York Times). The tariff must not be specifically targeted at electric vehicles manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all vehicles. If such a tariff meeting these criteria is implemented by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it anticipated that a substantial tariff will be placed on electric vehicles produced in China by the United States before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by the end of August 2024, the United States has officially established a tariff of 50% or more on the importation of electric vehicles made in China. This implementation must be validated by formal announcements from the U.S. government and reported by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The New York Times). The tariff must specifically apply to electric vehicles manufactured in China and should not be part of a wider tariff affecting all Chinese products or all vehicles. If such a tariff that satisfies these conditions is not enacted by the specified deadline, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

   - At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

2. The United States officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made electric vehicles. The implementation must be confirmed by official U.S. government announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The New York Times). The tariff must be specifically targeted at electric vehicles manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all vehicles.

If both of these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is not met by this date, the question resolves as NO.

2. The United States officially implements a tariff of less than 50% on imports of Chinese-made electric vehicles, or does NOT implement a tariff at all. The implementation must NOT be confirmed by official U.S. government announcements and NOT reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The New York Times). The tariff must NOT be specifically targeted at electric vehicles manufactured in China or be part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all vehicles.

If neither of these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If either condition is met by this date, the question resolves as NO.

This implementation must be validated by formal announcements from the U.S. government and reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The New York Times). question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current Nipah virus outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing Nipah virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will the World Health Organization not declare the current Nipah virus outbreak over by August 2024?

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy.

not_P.title: Will the Bank of England not announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England does not officially announce an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. question.title: Will India eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?

Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will be sufficient for a NO resolution. If either condition is met by their respective resolution dates, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that the following two events will happen: (a) the Bank of England will declare a reduction in interest rates by August 2024, and (b) India will abolish export duties on agricultural goods by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the subsequent events take place: (a) The Bank of England makes an official declaration regarding a decrease in the interest rate to be enacted by August 31, 2024. This declaration must be validated through official communications from the Bank of England, such as press releases, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses by Bank representatives. The actual date when the rate cut is put into effect may occur after August 31, 2024, provided that the announcement is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the Bank Rate, which serves as the primary instrument for monetary policy by the Bank of England. (b) By July 31, 2024, the Indian government makes a formal announcement or takes action to entirely remove export duties on agricultural goods. This policy must be confirmed through official government communications or reported by at least two credible international news organizations, such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or the Associated Press. Any partial reduction of export duties or the removal of duties on only select agricultural products will not suffice for a YES outcome. If both conditions are not fulfilled by their respective deadlines, the question will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will India's central bank's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if India's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Reserve Bank of India or a relevant Indian government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

question.title: Will Uber lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?

Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Uber confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Satya Nadella on X by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Satya Nadella on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Satya Nadella must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

If any of these conditions are not met by August 31, 2024, or if the interview does occur, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Mexican economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Mexican economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The question resolves as NO if the Mexican economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the Mexican economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Mexican economy enters a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The question resolves as NO if the Mexican economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Will Mexico's economy steer clear of a recession by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the Mexican economy has not fallen into a recession by July 31, 2024. For this question, a recession is characterized by two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. Conversely, the answer will be NO if the Mexican economy encounters two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Sony Corporation resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Sony Corporation not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
not_P.body:

2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is not achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if Sony Corporation successfully negotiates with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a notable strike by July 31, 2024. For this resolution to be deemed valid:

1. The strike must involve a considerable number of Sony Corporation employees (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike should endure for a minimum of one week.
3. The resolution must be validated by official communications from both Sony Corporation and the participating union.
4. The resolution must be covered by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no resolution that meets all these conditions is reached by the given date, or if no significant strike takes place, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (1) the Mexican economy avoids a recession and (2) Sony Corporation resolves a major workers' strike?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024:

1. The Mexican economy does not enter a recession. A recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The question resolves as NO if the Mexican economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

2. Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. The strike must involve at least 1,000 participants and last for at least one week. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by July 2024: (1) the Mexican economy avoids a recession nor (2) Sony Corporation resolves a major workers' strike?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if neither of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024:

1. The Mexican economy enters a recession. A recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The question resolves as NO if the Mexican economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

2. Sony Corporation does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike. The strike must involve at least 1,000 participants and last for at least one week. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is not achieved by the specified date, or if a significant strike does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (1) the Mexican economy successfully avoids a recession and (2) Sony Corporation comes to a resolution regarding a significant labor strike?
para_P.body:

A recession is characterized by two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as documented by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The answer will be NO if the Mexican economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

2. Sony Corporation successfully negotiates with unionized workers, leading to the conclusion of a major strike. This strike must involve a minimum of 1,000 participants and persist for at least one week. The resolution must be validated by official announcements from both Sony Corporation and the relevant union, and it should be reported by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If no resolution that meets all these criteria is reached by the given date, or if no significant strike takes place, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Astellas allow generic production of its prostate cancer drug by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Astellas officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its prostate cancer drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Astellas continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the European Central Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank officially announces a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the European Central Bank not announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank does not officially announce a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. The absence of an announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The lack of an interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution. If such an official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the European Central Bank will declare a reduction in interest rates before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the European Central Bank makes an official declaration regarding a reduction in its primary refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be validated through official communications from the ECB or reported by a minimum of two prominent financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or during a press conference after a meeting. Any conjecture regarding potential future rate reductions or unofficial remarks from individual ECB members will not be considered for resolution. If no official announcement regarding an interest rate reduction is issued by the resolution date, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Hyundai Motor Company resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Hyundai Motor Company reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Hyundai Motor Company not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if Hyundai Motor Company does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must not involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (fewer than 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must not last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union.
4. The resolution must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if a significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Hyundai Motor Company come to an agreement to end a significant workers' strike by July 2024?
para_P.body:

Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution.

Additionally, the resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

question.title: Will the S&P 500 index reach or exceed 4,800 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the S&P 500 index reaches or exceeds 4,800 points. The 4,800 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the New York Stock Exchange. If the index does not reach 4,800 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,800 points.

not_P.title: Will the S&P 500 index not reach or exceed 4,800 points by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at no point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the S&P 500 index reaches or exceeds 4,800 points. The 4,800 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the New York Stock Exchange. If the index reaches 4,800 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,800 points.

para_P.title: Will the S&P 500 index hit or surpass 4,800 points by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, at any time from October 1, 2023, to August 31, 2024, the S&P 500 index hits or surpasses 4,800 points. The 4,800 point threshold is selected as a significant value that the index may have reached prior to a major decline. Confirmation will rely on official index data from credible financial market information sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the New York Stock Exchange. If the index fails to reach 4,800 points during this timeframe, the inquiry will resolve as NO. It is important to note that intraday peaks are considered for resolution; the index does not have to close at or above 4,800 points.

question.title: Will Shopify lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Shopify has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Shopify confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

not_P.title: Will Shopify not lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Shopify has not confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must not come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must not be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Shopify confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as YES. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is it true that Shopify will terminate at least 1,800 staff members by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Shopify has officially acknowledged the termination of no fewer than 1,800 staff members as part of its reorganization strategy centered on AI. Such acknowledgment must be derived from official company communications, regulatory documents, or reports from at least two credible news outlets (including Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The terminations must be directly associated with the AI-centered reorganization plan that was revealed in 2023. If Shopify verifies a lower number of staff reductions, or if there is no confirmation that meets these standards by the resolution date, the inquiry will conclude as NO. Any partial layoffs or staggered implementations that do not achieve the 1,800 employee minimum by the resolution date will also lead to a NO conclusion.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the S&P 500 index reaches or exceeds 4,800 points by August 2024, and (b) Shopify lays off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body:

The index level will be verified using official reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the New York Stock Exchange. Intraday highs are considered valid for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,800 points.

(b) Shopify confirms the layoff of at least 1,800 employees by July 31, 2024, as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. This confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal. The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023.

If either condition (a) or (b) is not met, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) the S&P 500 index reaches or exceeds 4,800 points by August 2024, nor (b) Shopify lays off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
not_P.body:

(a) The S&P 500 index reaches or exceeds 4,800 points at any point between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024. The index level will be verified using official reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the New York Stock Exchange. Intraday highs are considered valid for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,800 points.

(b) Shopify confirms the layoff of at least 1,800 employees by July 31, 2024, as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023.

If both conditions (a) and (b) are met, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) the S&P 500 index hits or surpasses 4,800 points by August 2024, and (b) Shopify will terminate at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of these conditions are satisfied:

(a) The S&P 500 index hits or goes beyond 4,800 points at any time from October 1, 2023, to August 31, 2024. The level of the index will be confirmed using official data from recognized financial market information providers like Bloomberg, Reuters, or the New York Stock Exchange. (b) Shopify must verify the dismissal of at least 1,800 employees by July 31, 2024, as part of its restructuring plan focused on AI. This verification must come from official corporate announcements, regulatory submissions, or reports by a minimum of two trusted news outlets such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal. The layoffs need to be directly associated with the AI-centric restructuring plan revealed in 2023.

If either condition (a) or (b) is unmet, the question will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will the Philippine government enforce a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are confirmed reports that the Philippine government has successfully enforced a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines. The enforcement must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN) and involve official government actions leading to the cessation of operations for a significant number of these trading platforms. 'Significant' in this context means at least 50% of known Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The shutdown must be a result of government policy or directive, not due to voluntary closures or economic factors. If no such enforcement meeting these criteria is confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Philippine government not enforce a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are no confirmed reports that the Philippine government has successfully enforced a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines. The enforcement must not be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN) and must not involve official government actions leading to the cessation of operations for a significant number of these trading platforms. 'Significant' in this context means not at least 50% of known Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The shutdown must not be a result of government policy or directive, or it must be due to voluntary closures or economic factors. If such enforcement meeting these criteria is confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Philippine authorities implement a closure of online trading platforms operated by Chinese entities by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are verified reports indicating that the Philippine authorities have effectively carried out a closure of online trading platforms managed by Chinese entities within the Philippines. The closure must be reported by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN) and must involve official governmental actions resulting in the termination of operations for a substantial number of these trading platforms. 'Substantial' in this context refers to at least 50% of the known Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of the closure. The shutdown must stem from government policy or directive, rather than voluntary shutdowns or economic reasons. If no such enforcement that meets these criteria is confirmed by the resolution date, the inquiry will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will the International Monetary Fund announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the International Monetary Fund officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official IMF channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the International Monetary Fund not announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the International Monetary Fund does not officially announce one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must not be made through official IMF channels (such as their website or press releases) or must not be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must not be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, and must not be continuations of previously announced commitments. If such an announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments exceeds $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is the International Monetary Fund expected to declare fresh funding commitments exceeding $400 million by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the International Monetary Fund publicly declares one or more new funding commitments that sum to more than $400 million. The declaration(s) must be communicated through official IMF channels (such as their website or press releases) and covered by at least two credible news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must represent new initiatives or significant expansions of current programs, rather than extensions of previously announced commitments. If no such declaration occurs by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not surpass $400 million, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Philippine government enforces a shutdown of at least 50% of Chinese-run online trading platforms, and (b) The IMF announces new funding commitments totaling over $400 million?

The enforcement must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN) and involve official government actions leading to the cessation of operations for a significant number of these trading platforms. 'Significant' means at least 50% of known Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The shutdown must be a result of government policy or directive, not due to voluntary closures or economic factors. (b) The International Monetary Fund officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official IMF channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If both conditions are not met by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's climate disclosure rule be reinstated by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's rule on climate disclosures, previously blocked by a court decision, is reinstated. The reinstatement must be confirmed by official court documents or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The reinstatement could occur through a successful appeal, a reversal of the court's decision, or any other legal mechanism that results in the rule taking effect. If the rule remains blocked or is not reinstated by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's climate disclosure rule not be reinstated by July 2024?

If the rule is reinstated by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the climate disclosure regulation by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission be brought back by July 2024?

The rule's restoration could happen through a successful appeal, a reversal of the court's ruling, or any other legal means that results in the rule being enforced. If the regulation remains halted or is not restored by the given date, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will the NASDAQ Composite index reach or exceed 15,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the NASDAQ Composite index reaches or exceeds 15,000 points. The 15,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the NASDAQ Stock Market. If the index does not reach 15,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 15,000 points.

not_P.title: Will the NASDAQ Composite index not reach or exceed 15,000 points by August 2024?

question.title: Will California conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, California conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of California.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

not_P.title: Will California not conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, California does not conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must not be officially announced and conducted by the state of California.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must not be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If such a referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is California going to hold a vote on abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, California holds a public vote aimed explicitly at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a YES outcome, the following conditions must be satisfied:

1. The vote must be formally declared and carried out by the state of California.
2. The main emphasis of the vote must be on safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The results of the vote must be disclosed through official state channels or reputable news outlets.

If no such vote fulfilling these conditions takes place by August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be resolved as NO. It is important to note that simply suggesting or planning a vote without its actual execution by the given date does not meet the criteria for a YES outcome.

question.title: Will Oregon hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Oregon officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Oregon state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

not_P.title: Will Oregon not hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?

question.title: Will the FDA approve MDMA as a therapy for PTSD by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially approves MDMA (3,4-Methylenedioxymethamphetamine) for use as a therapy for Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the approval must be confirmed through an official announcement from the FDA and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The approval must specifically be for the use of MDMA in treating PTSD, not for any other condition or use. If no such approval is granted by the resolution date, or if the FDA explicitly rejects or delays the approval beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will the FDA not approve MDMA as a therapy for PTSD by August 2024?

For a positive resolution, the approval must not be confirmed through an official announcement from the FDA and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The approval must specifically not be for the use of MDMA in treating PTSD, or it could be for any other condition or use. If such approval is granted by the resolution date, or if the FDA explicitly approves or accelerates the approval before August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will MDMA receive FDA endorsement as a treatment for PTSD before August 2024?

If such endorsement is not granted by the resolution date, or if the FDA explicitly denies or postpones the endorsement beyond August 31, 2024, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Mexican authorities officially declare the dismantling of the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Mexican authorities (such as federal law enforcement agencies or high-ranking government officials) make an official public declaration stating that the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel has been dismantled or effectively neutralized as a criminal organization. The declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or major Mexican news sources). The declaration should indicate a significant disruption to the cartel's leadership structure, operations, or ability to function as a cohesive criminal entity. Mere arrests of individual members or partial disruptions to the cartel's activities do not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such official declaration meeting these criteria is made by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will Mexican authorities not officially declare the dismantling of the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel by July 2024?

The declaration should indicate no significant disruption to the cartel's leadership structure, operations, or ability to function as a cohesive criminal entity. Mere arrests of individual members or partial disruptions to the cartel's activities do not qualify for a NO resolution.
