not_P.title: Will the Central Bank of Israel not announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Israel does not officially announce a decrease in its interest rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Israel or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must not be a formal decision made by the Monetary Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Israel members will not count for resolution. If such an official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the Central Bank of Israel will declare a reduction in interest rates by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if the Central Bank of Israel makes a formal announcement regarding a reduction in its interest rate by July 31, 2024. The confirmation must come through official communications from the Central Bank of Israel or be reported by at least two prominent financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be an official decision taken by the Monetary Committee and conveyed in their formal statement or during a press conference following a meeting. Any conjecture about potential future rate reductions or informal comments from individual members of the Central Bank of Israel will not be considered for resolution. If no such formal announcement regarding an interest rate reduction is made by the specified resolution date, the question will resolve as negative.

question.title: Will large protests occur in the United Kingdom in response to healthcare funding cuts by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in the United Kingdom specifically in response to the government's decision to cut healthcare funding. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across the United Kingdom. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of healthcare funding cuts. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the funding cuts are rescinded before causing such protests, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will large protests not occur in the United Kingdom in response to healthcare funding cuts by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are no credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in the United Kingdom specifically in response to the government's decision to cut healthcare funding. To qualify as 'large', the protests must not involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across the United Kingdom. The protests must not be explicitly linked to the issue of healthcare funding cuts. If such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the funding cuts are rescinded before causing such protests, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will significant demonstrations take place in the UK due to reductions in healthcare funding by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are reliable reports from a minimum of two prominent international news organizations (like Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) regarding significant demonstrations in the UK specifically triggered by the government's choice to reduce healthcare funding. For the demonstrations to be considered 'significant', they must involve at least 1,000 individuals in a single event or multiple synchronized events accumulating to at least 1,000 participants throughout the UK. The demonstrations must be directly associated with the matter of healthcare funding reductions. If no demonstrations that fulfill these conditions occur by the stated date, or if the funding cuts are revoked before leading to such demonstrations, the inquiry will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) the Central Bank of Israel announces an interest rate cut, and (b) large protests occur in the UK in response to healthcare funding cuts?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Israel officially announces a decrease in its interest rate, confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Israel or reported by at least two major financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Israel members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, this part of the question resolves as NO. (b) There are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera of large protests in the United Kingdom specifically in response to the government's decision to cut healthcare funding. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across the United Kingdom. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of healthcare funding cuts. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the funding cuts are rescinded before causing such protests, this part of the question resolves as NO. The overall question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by July 2024: (a) the Central Bank of Israel announces an interest rate cut, nor (b) large protests occur in the UK in response to healthcare funding cuts?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Israel officially announces a decrease in its interest rate, confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Israel or reported by at least two major financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Israel members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, this part of the question resolves as YES. (b) There are no credible reports from at least two major international news outlets such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera of large protests in the United Kingdom specifically in response to the government's decision to cut healthcare funding. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across the United Kingdom. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of healthcare funding cuts. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the funding cuts are rescinded before causing such protests, this part of the question resolves as YES. The overall question resolves as YES only if neither (a) nor (b) resolves as YES.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events happen: (a) an announcement of a decrease in interest rates by the Central Bank of Israel, and (b) significant protests in the UK against cuts to healthcare funding?
para_P.body: This question will be considered TRUE if both of the following criteria are satisfied by July 31, 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Israel makes a formal declaration regarding a reduction in its interest rate, which must be verified through official communications from the Central Bank of Israel or reported by at least two prominent financial news organizations such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The interest rate reduction must be an official decision made by the Monetary Committee and conveyed in their formal statement or press conference after a meeting. Speculation about potential future rate cuts or unofficial comments from individual members of the Central Bank of Israel will not be sufficient for resolution. If no such formal announcement of an interest rate reduction is made by the resolution date, this part of the question will resolve as FALSE. (b) There must be credible coverage from at least two major international news organizations such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera regarding substantial protests in the United Kingdom specifically in reaction to the government's cuts to healthcare funding. To be deemed 'substantial', the protests must include at least 1,000 individuals in a single event or multiple coordinated events totaling at least 1,000 participants across the UK. The protests must be directly associated with the issue of healthcare funding cuts. If no protests that meet these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the funding cuts are reversed prior to inciting such protests, this part of the question will resolve as FALSE. The overall inquiry will resolve as TRUE only if both (a) and (b) resolve as TRUE.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

not_P.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage not exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, does not exceed 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate exceeds 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must not surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

para_P.title: Will the typical interest rate for a 15-year mortgage go beyond 5.5% by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, at any moment in August 2024, the typical interest rate for a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as indicated by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, is greater than 5.5%. The rate must be verified by official reports from Freddie Mac or trusted financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any time during August 2024, the inquiry will be deemed NO. To clarify, the rate must be higher than 5.5%, not just equal to it.

question.title: Will Nevada maintain its $11 per hour minimum wage for fast food workers through July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, as of July 31, 2024, the minimum wage for fast food workers in Nevada remains at $11 per hour or higher. The wage must be confirmed through official Nevada state announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). If the wage is reduced below $11 per hour at any point by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'fast food workers' refers to employees in fast food restaurants as defined by Nevada state law.

not_P.title: Will Nevada not maintain its $11 per hour minimum wage for fast food workers through July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, as of July 31, 2024, the minimum wage for fast food workers in Nevada is below $11 per hour. para_P.title: Will the $11 hourly minimum wage for fast food employees in Nevada stay in effect until July 2024?

If at any time before the resolution date the wage falls below $11 per hour, the inquiry will be considered NO. For this question, 'fast food employees' refers to workers in fast food establishments as defined by the laws of Nevada.

question.title: Will President Biden deliver a speech at a National Education Association event in Illinois by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, President Joe Biden delivers a speech at any National Education Association (NEA) event held in Illinois. The speech must be confirmed by official White House announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. If no such speech occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will President Biden not deliver a speech at a National Education Association event in Illinois by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, President Joe Biden does not deliver a speech at any National Education Association (NEA) event held in Illinois. The absence of the speech must be confirmed by official White House announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. If such a speech occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that President Biden will give a speech at a National Education Association gathering in Illinois before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, by July 31, 2024, President Joe Biden has spoken at any National Education Association (NEA) function taking place in Illinois. Confirmation of the speech must come from official announcements from the White House or reports from at least two credible news organizations. If no speech takes place by the resolution date, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the United Food and Commercial Workers endorse a candidate for the 2024 US presidential election by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the United Food and Commercial Workers (UFCW) publicly endorses a candidate for the 2024 United States presidential election. The endorsement must be confirmed through official UFCW statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The endorsement must clearly indicate support for a specific candidate in the 2024 presidential race. If no such endorsement is made or publicly announced by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider hypothetical or speculative endorsements; only official, public endorsements will be considered for resolution.

not_P.title: Will the United Food and Commercial Workers not endorse a candidate for the 2024 US presidential election by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the United Food and Commercial Workers (UFCW) does not publicly endorse a candidate for the 2024 United States presidential election. The lack of endorsement must be confirmed through official UFCW statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). There must be no clear indication of support for any specific candidate in the 2024 presidential race. If such an endorsement is made or publicly announced by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider hypothetical or speculative endorsements; only official, public endorsements will be considered for resolution.

para_P.title: Will the United Food and Commercial Workers publicly support a candidate for the 2024 US presidential election before July 2024?

The UFCW endorsement must clearly indicate support for a specific candidate in the 2024 presidential race. para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) President Biden gives a speech at a National Education Association gathering in Illinois, and (b) the United Food and Commercial Workers support a candidate for the upcoming 2024 US presidential election?

The endorsement from UFCW must clearly express support for a particular candidate in the 2024 presidential election. If either or both of these events do not take place by the specified resolution date, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will PepsiCo report increased North American demand for its Tostitos brand by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Tostitos brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If no such increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports continued decline or stagnation in demand for Tostitos in North America, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will PepsiCo report no increased North American demand for its Tostitos brand by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo does not report an increase in North American demand for its Tostitos brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The lack of increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should not be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If such an increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports an increase in demand for Tostitos in North America, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will there be a rise in North American demand for PepsiCo's Tostitos brand?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, on or before July 31, 2024, PepsiCo announces a rise in demand for its Tostitos brand in North America compared to the demand figures from the second quarter of 2023. This increase must be validated through official earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and corroborated by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The increase in demand should be explicitly mentioned or clearly indicated in the company's financial disclosures or official communications. If there is no such increase reported by the given date, or if PepsiCo indicates a continued drop or stagnation in Tostitos demand in North America, the inquiry will be deemed NO.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 200,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 200,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

not_P.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims not exceed 200,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, does not exceed 200,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

para_P.title: Will there be more than 200,000 weekly jobless claims in the U.S. for a span of four straight weeks before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if the weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as documented by the U.S. Department of Labor, surpass 200,000 for a continuous period of four weeks at any time leading up to August 31, 2024. It will be considered negative if this scenario does not occur within the given timeframe. For the purpose of resolution, only official statistics published by the U.S. Department of Labor will be taken into account.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) PepsiCo reports increased North American demand for its Tostitos brand by July 2024, and (b) U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 200,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Tostitos brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. This increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If no such increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports continued decline or stagnation in demand for Tostitos in North America, this part will resolve as NO. (b) The number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 200,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered. The combined question will resolve as YES only if both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) PepsiCo does not report increased North American demand for its Tostitos brand by July 2024, nor (b) U.S. weekly jobless claims do not exceed 200,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, PepsiCo does not report an increase in North American demand for its Tostitos brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. This lack of increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand decrease or stagnation should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If such an increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports an increase in demand for Tostitos in North America, this part will resolve as YES. The question will resolve as YES if this condition is met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered. The combined question will resolve as YES only if both conditions (a) and (b) are not satisfied.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) PepsiCo will announce a rise in North American demand for its Tostitos brand by July 2024, and (b) U.S. weekly jobless claims will surpass 200,000 for four straight weeks by August 2024?

This increase must be validated through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and confirmed by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). question.title: Will Google resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Google reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Google workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Alibaba Group resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:

2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Alibaba Group and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Mexico announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Mexico officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Mexico communications, such as press releases, Governing Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the target for the overnight interbank interest rate, which is the Central Bank of Mexico's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will Google resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Google reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Google workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Google not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?

3. The resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union.
4. The resolution must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is not achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as YES.

question.title: Will another U.S. state implement a 72-hour waiting period for voting registration by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, at least one additional U.S. state (other than Maine and those that already have such measures) implements a mandatory 72-hour waiting period for voting registration. question.title: Will the French economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the French economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. The question resolves as NO if the French economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the French economy does enter a recession. question.title: Will the Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Central Bank of Mexico or a relevant Mexican government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, El Financiero). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

question.title: Will Tim Scott publicly retract his statement about Biden's stance on criminal justice reform?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Tim Scott publicly retracts or significantly alters his statement regarding Joe Biden's position on criminal justice reform. The retraction or alteration must be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). A significant alteration would involve a substantial change to the core message of his original statement, not just a minor clarification or rewording. If no such retraction or significant alteration is reported by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'publicly' means through official statements, interviews, social media posts from verified accounts, or during public appearances.

question.title: Will Nicholas Collon be recognized as the youngest music director of a major orchestra by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Nicholas Collon is officially recognized and announced by at least two reputable music industry publications or organizations as the youngest music director of a major orchestra. The recognition must be based on his age at the time of his appointment to a major orchestra, such as the London Philharmonic. A 'major orchestra' is defined as a professional symphony orchestra with international recognition and a regular concert season. The recognition must explicitly state that he is the youngest person to hold such a position. question.title: Will Spain's IBEX 35 index reach or exceed 10,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Spain's IBEX 35 index reaches or exceeds 10,000 points. The 10,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Bolsa de Madrid. If the index does not reach 10,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 10,000 points.

question.title: Will the NFL settle the 'Sunday Ticket' antitrust case for less than $4.7 billion by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if by July 31, 2024, the NFL reaches a settlement in the 'Sunday Ticket' antitrust case for an amount less than $4,707,259,944. The settlement must be officially confirmed through court documents or public announcements by involved parties. If no such settlement is reached by the resolution date, or if the settlement amount is equal to or more than $4.7 billion, the question resolves as NO. For context, as of October 1, 2023, a federal jury has ordered the NFL to pay this amount for violating antitrust laws in distributing out-of-market Sunday afternoon games on a premium subscription service.

question.title: Will Illinois maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has reversed this decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

question.title: Will the U.S. Senate pass a bill to cut the NASA budget by more than 20% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States Senate passes a bill that includes a reduction of more than 20% in the budget of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) compared to its current fiscal year's budget. The passage must be confirmed by official Senate records and reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If no such bill is passed by the Senate by the resolution date, or if a bill is passed but the budget cut is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions of budget cuts do not count; the bill must be officially passed by the Senate.

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces a decrease in its bank rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Bank of England or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual BoE members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the German economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the German economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany. The question resolves as NO if the German economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will an enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members be established by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, an enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Congress members is officially adopted by the United States government. The adoption must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Congress members. It should outline clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement. If no such code meeting these criteria is established and officially adopted by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions about such a code do not qualify for a YES resolution; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable.

It is important to note that simply having proposals or discussions regarding such a code does not qualify for a YES resolution; the code must be formally enacted and enforceable.

question.title: Will Michigan hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Michigan officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Michigan state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

The question will resolve as YES if either or both of the above conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events going to take place: (1) A binding ethics code for members of the U.S. Congress will be established by July 2024 and (2) Michigan will hold a vote on abortion rights by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. A binding ethics code specifically for members of the U.S. Congress is officially enacted by the United States government by July 31, 2024. This enactment must be verified by at least two major, credible news organizations (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must have legal force and apply to all current Congress members. It should specify clear standards of behavior and enforcement mechanisms. If no such code that meets these requirements is established and officially enacted by the deadline, this part of the question will be answered as NO. Note that mere discussions or proposals regarding such a code do not qualify for a YES answer; the code must be formally enacted and binding.

2. Michigan officially holds a public vote specifically aimed at securing protections for abortion rights in the state by August 31, 2024. For a YES answer, the vote must be officially announced and carried out by the Michigan state government, directly address the issue of abortion rights protection, and the results must be made publicly available through official state channels or widely recognized news outlets. The question will be answered as NO if no such vote occurs by August 31, 2024, if a planned vote is canceled or delayed past the specified date, or if a vote is conducted but does not specifically focus on securing protections for abortion rights. Note: This question does not evaluate the outcome of the vote, only whether it occurs within the specified timeframe.

The question will resolve as NO if either or both of the above conditions are not satisfied.

question.title: Will Google reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Google and the UK data protection authority reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations. The settlement must be confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The settlement should specifically address the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. If no such settlement is reached or publicly confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a YES resolution.

not_P.title: Will Google not reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Google and the UK data protection authority do not reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations. The settlement must not be confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The settlement should not specifically address the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. If such a settlement is reached or publicly confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Will Google finalize an agreement with the UK data protection regulator before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, Google and the UK data protection regulator come to a formal agreement concerning a penalty levied against Google for purported data protection breaches. This agreement must be validated by official announcements from either party or reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or prominent national newspapers). The agreement should specifically pertain to the penalty imposed by the UK regulator on Google. If no such agreement is finalized or publicly acknowledged by the resolution date, the inquiry will be answered with NO. It is important to note that appeals, ongoing discussions, or partial agreements do not meet the criteria for a YES response.

question.title: Will the European Commission implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the European Commission officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels. The implementation must be confirmed by official European Commission announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must be specifically targeted at solar panels manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods. If no such tariff meeting these criteria is implemented by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the European Commission not implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the European Commission does not officially implement a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels. The implementation must not be confirmed by official European Commission announcements and not reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must not be specifically targeted at solar panels manufactured in China and must be part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods. If such a tariff meeting these criteria is implemented by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the European Commission will put a substantial tariff on solar panels produced in China before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, the European Commission officially enacts a tariff of 50% or more on the importation of solar panels made in China. Confirmation of this implementation must come from official announcements by the European Commission and be reported by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must exclusively apply to solar panels manufactured in China, rather than being part of a wider tariff affecting all products from China or all electronic items. If no tariff that fulfills these requirements is enacted by the given deadline, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Google will reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority, and (b) the European Commission will implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) Google and the UK data protection authority reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations. The settlement must be confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The settlement should specifically address the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. If no such settlement is reached or publicly confirmed by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO. Note that appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a YES resolution. (b) The European Commission officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels. The implementation must be confirmed by official European Commission announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must be specifically targeted at solar panels manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods. If no such tariff meeting these criteria is implemented by the specified date, this part resolves as NO. The entire question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Google will reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority, nor (b) the European Commission will implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if neither of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) Google and the UK data protection authority reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations. The settlement must be confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The settlement should specifically address the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. If such a settlement is reached or publicly confirmed by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO. Note that appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a YES resolution. (b) The European Commission officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels. The implementation must be confirmed by official European Commission announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must be specifically targeted at solar panels manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods. If such a tariff meeting these criteria is implemented by the specified date, this part resolves as NO. The entire question resolves as YES only if neither (a) nor (b) resolve as YES.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will both of the following take place: (a) a settlement be reached between Google and the UK data protection authority, and (b) will the European Commission impose a significant tariff on solar panels produced in China?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered a YES if both of the following conditions are fulfilled by August 31, 2024: (a) a formal settlement agreement is established between Google and the UK data protection authority regarding a penalty levied on Google for alleged breaches of data protection regulations. This settlement must be validated by official communications from either party or reported by at least two credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The settlement should specifically focus on the penalty imposed by the UK authority on Google. If such a settlement is not achieved or publicly acknowledged by the resolution date, this aspect will resolve as NO. It is important to note that appeals, ongoing discussions, or partial agreements do not qualify for a YES resolution. (b) the European Commission officially enforces a tariff of 50% or more on imports of solar panels manufactured in China. This implementation must be confirmed by official announcements from the European Commission and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must be specifically aimed at solar panels produced in China and not part of a broader tariff affecting all Chinese products or all electronic items. If no such tariff meeting these conditions is enacted by the specified date, this aspect will resolve as NO. The entire question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) are confirmed as YES.

question.title: Will Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income increase by over 20% year-over-year by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Mercedes-Benz reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the specified timeframe.

not_P.title: Will Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income not increase by over 20% year-over-year by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if Mercedes-Benz does not report a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If such an increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is more than 20%, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net profit will rise by more than 20% year-over-year by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if Mercedes-Benz discloses a net profit growth exceeding 20% for any quarter in comparison to the same quarter from the prior year, as indicated in its official financial disclosures made by July 31, 2024. The growth must be substantiated through official company earnings reports or by at least three reputable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Wall Street Journal). If no such growth is documented by the resolution date, or if the highest recorded growth is 20% or less, the inquiry will conclude as NO. It is important to note that this question does not focus on any particular quarter, but rather on any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the designated timeframe.

question.title: Will the Canadian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Canadian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. The question resolves as NO if the Canadian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the Canadian economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Canadian economy enters a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. The question resolves as NO if the Canadian economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the Canadian economy to steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Canadian economy has not entered a recession. For the purposes of this question, a recession is characterized by two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. The answer will be NO if the Canadian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (1) Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income increases by over 20% year-over-year, and (2) the Canadian economy avoids a recession?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (1) Mercedes-Benz reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, this part resolves as NO. Note that this part does not consider any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the specified timeframe. (2) The Canadian economy does not enter a recession by July 31, 2024. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. This part resolves as NO if the Canadian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. The overall question resolves as YES only if both conditions are satisfied.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by July 2024: (1) Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income increases by over 20% year-over-year, nor (2) the Canadian economy enters a recession?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if neither of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (1) Mercedes-Benz reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If such an increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is more than 20%, this part resolves as NO. Note that this part does not consider any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the specified timeframe. (2) The Canadian economy enters a recession by July 31, 2024. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. This part resolves as YES if the Canadian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. The overall question resolves as YES only if neither condition is satisfied.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will both of these events take place: (1) an increase of over 20% in Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net earnings year-over-year, and (2) the Canadian economy steering clear of a recession?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if the following two criteria are fulfilled by July 31, 2024: (1) Mercedes-Benz must disclose a net earnings boost exceeding 20% for any quarter when compared to the same quarter from the previous year, in their official financial disclosures released by July 31, 2024. This increase must be corroborated through official company earnings reports or by at least three reliable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is documented by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or lower, this segment will resolve as NO. It is important to note that this segment does not focus on any particular quarter, but rather on any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the designated timeframe. (2) The Canadian economy must not fall into a recession by July 31, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a recession is characterized by two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. This part will resolve as NO if the Canadian economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. The overall question will resolve as YES only if both conditions are satisfied.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate remain at or above 13.25% in August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to be at or above 13.25% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 13.25% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate not remain at or above 13.25% in August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to be below 13.25% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to have remained at or above 13.25% throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Brazil's Central Bank maintain its Selic rate at 13.25% or higher during August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if the Selic rate set by Brazil's Central Bank is noted to be at or above 13.25% at any time throughout August 2024. Verification must be obtained from official announcements by the Central Bank of Brazil or from at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or Folha de S.Paulo). Conversely, if the rate is reported to have fallen below 13.25% and stays below this threshold for the entirety of August 2024, the inquiry will be marked as NO.

question.title: Will Argentine agricultural workers remain on strike through August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike.

not_P.title: Will Argentine agricultural workers not remain on strike through August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are not still on strike and have fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have not fully returned to work and normal operations have not resumed before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. Partial returns to work or limited operations do count as a full resolution of the strike.

para_P.title: Will the agricultural labor force in Argentina continue their strike until the end of August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by the date of August 31, 2024, the agricultural labor force in Argentina remains on strike or has not completely resumed normal activities following any ongoing labor conflict. The verification of the strike status or the resumption of work must be substantiated by official announcements from agricultural associations, the unions representing the workforce, or the Argentine authorities, and reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workforce has entirely returned to their jobs and normal operations have been restored prior to or during August 2024, the response will be NO. Any partial return to work or restricted operations does not qualify as a complete resolution of the strike.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate remains at or above 13.25% in August 2024, and (b) Argentine agricultural workers remain on strike through August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to be at or above 13.25% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 13.25% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, this condition is not met.

(b) By August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, this condition is not met. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike.

The question resolves as NO if either of these conditions is not met.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate falls below 13.25% in August 2024, nor (b) Argentine agricultural workers fully resume normal operations before August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if neither of the following conditions are met:

(a) The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to fall below 13.25% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to have remained at or above 13.25% throughout August 2024, this condition is not met.

(b) By August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina have fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers are still on strike or have not fully returned to work before or during August 2024, this condition is not met. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike.

The question resolves as NO if either of these conditions is met.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) The Selic rate set by Brazil's Central Bank stays at or above 13.25% during August 2024, and (b) Agricultural laborers in Argentina continue their strike until the end of August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry is answered with a YES if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied:

(a) The Selic rate from Brazil's Central Bank is reported to be at or above 13.25% at any time throughout August 2024. Verification must come from official announcements by the Central Bank of Brazil or at least two credible financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to have fallen below 13.25% and stays below this threshold for the entire month of August 2024, this criterion is not fulfilled.

(b) By August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are still on strike or have not completely returned to normal operations following any existing labor conflict. The status of the strike or work resumption must be validated by official declarations from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two trustworthy news agencies (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have completely resumed work and normal operations have restarted before or during August 2024, this criterion is not fulfilled. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike.

The inquiry is answered with a NO if either of these criteria is not satisfied.

question.title: Will Sony Corporation resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Sony Corporation not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if Sony Corporation does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must not involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (fewer than 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must not last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if a significant strike does occur, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Sony Corporation come to an agreement to end a significant workers' strike before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered as YES if Sony Corporation successfully negotiates with the unionized workforce, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For this outcome to be deemed valid:

1. The strike must involve a considerable number of employees from Sony Corporation (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must persist for a minimum duration of one week.
3. The result must be validated by official announcements from both Sony Corporation and the relevant union.
4. The outcome must be reported by at least two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If there is no resolution that meets all these conditions by the designated date, or if no major strike takes place, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

not_P.title: Will the United States not maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States does not continue to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is maintained at 100% or is not reduced below 100% at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

para_P.title: Will the United States uphold a full 100% tariff on machinery produced in China until August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if, on August 31, 2024, the United States is still applying a 100% tariff on the importation of machinery manufactured in China. The presence and percentage of the tariff must be confirmed by official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and supported by at least two credible news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is decreased below 100% or entirely lifted at any time up to and including August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be resolved as FALSE. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly designated as temporary and do not permanently change the 100% rate will not influence the resolution of this inquiry.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Sony Corporation resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024 (b) The United States maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES only if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Sony Corporation must reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For this resolution to be considered valid:
   1. The strike must involve at least 1,000 participants from Sony Corporation workers.
   2. The strike must last for at least one week.
   3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
   4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).
   If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this part resolves as NO.

(b) As of August 31, 2024, the United States must continue to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

The question resolves as NO if either or both of these conditions are not met.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Sony Corporation does not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024 (b) The United States does not maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES only if neither of the following conditions are met:

(a) Sony Corporation does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike beyond July 31, 2024. For this resolution to be considered valid:
   1. The strike must involve at least 1,000 participants from Sony Corporation workers.
   2. The strike must last for at least one week.
   3. The resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
   4. The resolution must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).
   If a resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if a significant strike does not occur, this part resolves as YES.

(b) As of August 31, 2024, the United States must not continue to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery. The existence and rate of the tariff must not be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and must not be corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is maintained at 100% at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, this part resolves as YES. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

The question resolves as YES if either or both of these conditions are met.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following happen: (a) Sony Corporation settles a significant workers' strike by July 2024 (b) The United States keeps a 100% tariff on machinery made in China until August 2024?
para_P.body:
This question is answered with YES only if both of these conditions are satisfied:

(a) Sony Corporation must come to a settlement with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For this to be considered valid:
   1. The strike must involve no fewer than 1,000 employees from Sony Corporation.
   2. The strike must persist for a minimum of one week.
   3. The settlement must be verified by official announcements from both Sony Corporation and the participating union.
   4. The settlement must be reported by at least two credible international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).
   If no such settlement fulfilling all these criteria is reached by the stated date, or if no major strike takes place, this part resolves as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, the United States must continue to enforce a 100% tariff on the importation of machinery produced in China. The existence and level of the tariff must be confirmed through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and supported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is lowered below 100% or entirely abolished at any time up to and including August 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently change the 100% rate will not influence the resolution of this question.

The question resolves as NO if either or both of these conditions are not fulfilled.

question.title: Will Sara Lee issue a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Sara Lee officially announces a recall of any of its packaged meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Sara Lee's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Sara Lee
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Sara Lee recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will Sara Lee not issue a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
not_P.body:
