1. No official announcement on Sara Lee's website or social media channels
2. No press release from Sara Lee
3. No announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Sara Lee recall
4. No reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The absence of a recall must not explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If such a recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

The recall must clearly state listeria as the cause for the product removal. If no such recall that meets these conditions is reported by the designated date, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will the E. coli outbreak tied to lettuce result in more than 10 confirmed deaths by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are official reports confirming more than 10 deaths attributed to the E. coli outbreak linked to lettuce from a specific producer. Official confirmation must come from credible sources such as the CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) or equivalent health authorities, and be reported by at least two reputable news outlets. The death toll must be specifically linked to this outbreak and not include deaths from unrelated E. coli cases. If the death toll remains at 10 or fewer by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, only deaths directly attributed to this specific outbreak will be counted.

question.title: Will a government-developed AI system be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a government-developed AI system is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the government-developed AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Apple fund full tuition for all Caltech physics students by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, it is officially confirmed that Apple's funding is being used to cover full tuition for all physics students at Caltech, regardless of their family income. If the funding does not cover full tuition for all physics students by the resolution date, or if it only covers tuition for a subset of students based on income or other criteria, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Apple not fund full tuition for all Caltech physics students by July 2024?

para_P.title: Will Apple provide complete tuition support for every Caltech physics student by July 2024?

question.title: Will Facebook resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Facebook reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Facebook workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Facebook and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Facebook not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if Facebook does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from both Facebook and the involved union.
4. The resolution must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is not achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as YES.

para_P.title: Will Facebook come to an agreement to end a significant workers' strike by July 2024?
para_P.body:

question.title: Will Nigeria maintain its ban on cryptocurrency transactions through August, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the government of Nigeria has not officially reversed its existing ban on cryptocurrency transactions. The ban must remain in place without any changes that would effectively legalize the transactions. Confirmation of the ban's status should be available through official government sources or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. If the ban is reversed or significantly weakened to effectively allow cryptocurrency transactions before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Nigeria not maintain its ban on cryptocurrency transactions through August, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the government of Nigeria has officially reversed its existing ban on cryptocurrency transactions or if the ban has been significantly weakened to effectively allow cryptocurrency transactions. para_P.title: Will Nigeria continue its prohibition on cryptocurrency dealings until August 2024?

If the prohibition is lifted or significantly relaxed to effectively permit cryptocurrency dealings before or during August 2024, the inquiry will conclude as NO.

question.title: Will Russia's Federation Council pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Russia's Federation Council not pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia's Federation Council does not pass a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must not be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must not be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must not be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must not be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

If a bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed that meets all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Federation Council of Russia enact a significant economic reform legislation that President Putin is against before August 2024?
para_P.body:

4. The legislation must be characterized as 'significant' or 'major' by these news outlets in terms of its potential effects on the Russian economy.

If no such legislation is enacted by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a legislation is enacted but does not meet all the above criteria, the inquiry resolves as NO.

The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy. If no such bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, this condition is not met.

The question resolves as NO if either or both of these conditions are not met.

not_P.title: Will Nigeria not maintain its ban on cryptocurrency transactions through August 2024, or will Russia's Federation Council not pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?

Nigeria does not maintain its ban on cryptocurrency transactions, meaning the government of Nigeria has officially reversed its existing ban or the ban has been significantly weakened to effectively allow cryptocurrency transactions. If the ban remains in place without changes that would effectively legalize the transactions before or during August 2024, this condition is met.

2. Russia's Federation Council does not pass a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must not be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times). The bill must not be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy. If such a bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, that meets all the above criteria, this condition is met.

para_P.title: Will Nigeria continue to prohibit cryptocurrency transactions until August 2024, and will the Federation Council of Russia enact a significant economic reform bill that is opposed by President Putin by August 2024?

If no such bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not satisfy all the aforementioned criteria, this criterion is not fulfilled.

The inquiry will be considered negative if either or both of these criteria are not satisfied.

question.title: Will the Indonesian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indonesian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Indonesia. The question resolves as NO if the Indonesian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the Indonesian economy enter a recession by July 2024?

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current measles outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing measles outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Iowa Senate pass a total abortion ban by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Iowa Senate successfully passes legislation enacting a total abortion ban. For the purpose of this question, a 'total abortion ban' refers to legislation that prohibits all or nearly all abortions, with possible exceptions only for cases involving rape, incest, or threat to the mother's life. The passage of such legislation must be confirmed through official Iowa legislative records. If no such legislation is passed by the specified date, or if only partial restrictions are enacted, the question will resolve as NO. question.title: Will Cruise's robotaxis be available on Didi's ride-hailing service in China by August 2024?

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 250,000 for five consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 250,000 for five consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. question.title: Will the Australian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Australian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Australian Bureau of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Australian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the Australian economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Australian economy enters a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Australian Bureau of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Australian economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can Australia steer clear of a recession before July 2024?

The inquiry will be deemed negative if the Australian economy undergoes two successive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will U.S. previously occupied home sales show a decline for two consecutive months by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are two consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show a decline compared to the previous month. The data must be verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other widely recognized real estate market analysts. The declines must be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If no such consecutive monthly declines are reported by the resolution date, or if only a single month shows a decline, the question resolves as NO.

If such consecutive monthly declines are reported by the resolution date, or if two or more months show a decline, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current polio outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing polio outbreak over by August 31, 2024. question.title: Will the Central Bank of Indonesia announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Indonesia officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank Indonesia communications, such as press releases, Board of Governors statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the BI 7-day reverse repo rate, which is the Central Bank of Indonesia's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will South Dakota hold a referendum on environmental policies by July 2024?

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Brazil officially announces a decrease in its Selic rate by July 31, 2024. The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee (COPOM) and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Brazil members will not count for resolution. question.title: Will the WHO declare the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Rift Valley fever that does not specifically address the East African outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

2. This declaration must not be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).

question.title: Will Russia's Federation Council pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
question.body:

3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).

question.title: Will the median Canadian home price reach a new record high by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the median price of existing homes sold in Canada reaches a new record high, surpassing any previous monthly median price on record. The record must be confirmed by data from the Canadian Real Estate Association or other widely recognized real estate data providers such as Royal LePage or RE/MAX. The median price refers to the middle price in the range of home prices sold, where half of the homes sold for more and half sold for less. If no new record high is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported median price does not exceed the current record, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question focuses on the nominal price, not adjusted for inflation.

question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: 

(a) New York City officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units (such as those typically listed on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. The announcement must come from an official source within New York City's local government and be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The restrictions or regulations should be specifically targeted at reducing the number of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering the way they operate. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will not be sufficient for a YES resolution.

(b) The median price of existing homes sold in Canada reaches a new record high, surpassing any previous monthly median price on record. The record must be confirmed by data from the Canadian Real Estate Association or other widely recognized real estate data providers such as Royal LePage or RE/MAX. The median price refers to the middle price in the range of home prices sold, where half of the homes sold for more and half sold for less. If no new record high is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported median price does not exceed the current record, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question focuses on the nominal price, not adjusted for inflation.

If both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied by the resolution date, the question resolves as YES. If either or both conditions are not satisfied, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following NOT occur by July 2024: (a) New York City does not announce plans to restrict short-term rental units (b) The median Canadian home price does not reach a new record high?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if at least one of the following conditions is met by July 31, 2024: 

(a) New York City does not officially announce plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units (such as those typically listed on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. The absence of an announcement from an official source within New York City's local government, or if such an announcement is not reported by at least two reputable international news organizations, will lead to a YES resolution. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will also not be sufficient for a YES resolution.

(b) The median price of existing homes sold in Canada does not reach a new record high, failing to surpass any previous monthly median price on record. The absence of a record confirmed by data from the Canadian Real Estate Association or other widely recognized real estate data providers such as Royal LePage or RE/MAX will lead to a YES resolution. The median price refers to the middle price in the range of home prices sold, where half of the homes sold for more and half sold for less. If a new record high is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported median price exceeds the current record, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question focuses on the nominal price, not adjusted for inflation.

If at least one of the conditions (a) or (b) is not satisfied by the resolution date, the question resolves as YES. If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) New York City reveals plans to limit short-term rental units (b) The median price of homes in Canada hits a new all-time high?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled by July 31, 2024: 

(a) New York City officially discloses plans or regulations intended to restrict or control the availability of short-term rental units (such as those typically listed on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. The announcement must originate from an official entity within New York City's local government and be covered by at least two reputable international news outlets. The restrictions or regulations should specifically aim at decreasing the number of short-term rental units accessible to tourists or changing their operational methods. Simple discussions or proposals without a formal declaration will not suffice for a YES outcome.

(b) The median price of existing homes sold in Canada achieves a new record high, exceeding any prior monthly median price on record. This record must be validated by data from the Canadian Real Estate Association or other widely acknowledged real estate data sources such as Royal LePage or RE/MAX. The median price refers to the midpoint price in the range of home prices sold, where half of the homes sold for more and half sold for less. If no new record high is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported median price does not surpass the current record, the question will resolve as NO. It is important to note that this question pertains to the nominal price, not adjusted for inflation.

If both criteria (a) and (b) are met by the resolution date, the question will resolve as YES. If either or both criteria are not met, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 300,000 for three consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

For the purpose of resolution, only the official statistics published by the U.S. Department of Labor will be taken into account.

question.title: Will US airline mechanics remain on strike through August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, airline mechanics in the United States are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from the airlines, the unions representing the mechanics, or the US government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as The New York Times, CNN, or Reuters). If the mechanics have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike.

not_P.title: Will US airline mechanics not remain on strike through August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, airline mechanics in the United States are not still on strike and have fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. If the mechanics have not fully returned to work and normal operations have not resumed before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. para_P.title: Will US airline mechanics still be on strike by the end of August 2024?

Any partial return to work or limited operational capacity does not equate to a full resolution of the strike.

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces a decrease in its bank rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Bank of England or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual BoE members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Russia's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Russia's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Central Bank of Russia or a relevant Russian government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, TASS). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India not announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India does not officially announce a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. question.title: Will the Central Bank of Singapore announce a new exchange rate policy by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Singapore officially announces a new exchange rate policy. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Singapore communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Singapore. The announcement should explicitly describe the new exchange rate policy. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Singapore maintains the current exchange rate policy, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Central Bank of Singapore not announce a new exchange rate policy by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Singapore does not officially announce a new exchange rate policy. The announcement must not come from an official Central Bank of Singapore communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Singapore. The announcement should not explicitly describe the new exchange rate policy. The announcement must not be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If such an announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Singapore does not maintain the current exchange rate policy, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the Central Bank of Singapore will introduce a new exchange rate policy before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed as YES if, on or before August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Singapore publicly declares a new exchange rate policy. Such a declaration must come through an official communication from the Central Bank of Singapore, including but not limited to a press release or a public address by the Governor of the Central Bank of Singapore. The declaration must clearly outline the new exchange rate policy. Furthermore, it is required that the announcement is covered by at least two prominent financial news organizations (for instance, Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) for it to be recognized as valid. If no announcement is made by the designated date, or if the Central Bank of Singapore continues with the existing exchange rate policy, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Reserve Bank of India announces an interest rate cut by July 2024 (b) The Central Bank of Singapore announces a new exchange rate policy by August 2024?

The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. (b) The Central Bank of Singapore officially announces a new exchange rate policy by August 31, 2024. question.title: Will General Motors resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if General Motors reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of General Motors workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both General Motors and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

   3. For clarity, a rate of exactly 6.2% will not be considered as falling below 6.2%.

The overall question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) LG Electronics does not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024 (b) The average rate on a 30-year mortgage in the US does not fall below 6.2% by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if neither of the following conditions are met:

(a) LG Electronics does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike beyond July 31, 2024. For this part to resolve as YES:
   1. The strike must involve a substantial number of LG Electronics workers (at least 1,000 participants).
   2. The strike must last for at least one week.
   3. The resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from both LG Electronics and the involved union.
   4. The resolution must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).
   If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if a significant strike occurs, this part resolves as NO.

(b) The average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, does not fall below 6.2% at any point by August 31, 2024. For this part to resolve as YES:
   1. The rate must not be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC.
   2. If the rate falls below 6.2% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac discontinues reporting this metric, this part resolves as NO.
   3. For clarity, a rate of exactly 6.2% will be considered as not falling below 6.2%.

The overall question resolves as YES only if neither (a) nor (b) resolve as YES.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following two events to happen: (a) LG Electronics successfully ends a significant workers' strike by July 2024 (b) The average interest rate on a 30-year mortgage in the US drops below 6.2% by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This question is considered YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

(a) LG Electronics comes to a resolution with its unionized workforce, concluding a major strike by July 31, 2024. For this part to be answered YES:
   1. The strike must involve a considerable number of LG Electronics employees (at least 1,000 participants).
   2. The duration of the strike must be a minimum of one week.
   3. The agreement must be verified by official announcements from both LG Electronics and the relevant union.
   4. The resolution must be reported by at least two credible international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).
   If a resolution that meets all these conditions is not reached by the deadline, or if no major strike takes place, this part resolves as NO.

(b) The average interest rate on a 30-year fixed mortgage in the United States, as recorded by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 6.2% at any time before August 31, 2024. For this part to be considered YES:
   1. The rate must be validated by official reports from Freddie Mac or by at least two reputable financial news organizations such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC.
   2. If the rate does not decrease below 6.2% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac stops reporting this figure, this part resolves as NO.
   3. For clarity, a rate of exactly 6.2% will not count as falling below 6.2%.

The overall question will only be answered YES if both (a) and (b) are answered YES.

question.title: Will Russia report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia reports a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The success must be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). For this question, 'successful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and barley being at least 5% above the five-year average. If the winter crop season does not meet these criteria, or if insufficient data is available to make a determination, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Russia report an unsuccessful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia does not report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields not meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The success must not be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). For this question, 'unsuccessful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and barley being less than 5% above the five-year average. If the winter crop season meets these criteria, or if sufficient data is available to make a determination, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Russia announce a prosperous winter harvest of wheat and barley by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia announces a prosperous winter harvest of wheat and barley, indicated by yields that are equal to or surpass the average of the previous five years. The prosperity must be validated by official agricultural data from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or by at least three credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). For the purpose of this question, 'prosperous' is defined as the total output of wheat and barley being at least 5% higher than the five-year average. If the winter harvest does not fulfill these conditions, or if there is inadequate data to reach a conclusion, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Russia announce plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Russian government officially announces plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. The announcement must come from an official government source, such as the Kremlin or Rosatom, and be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The announcement must clearly indicate an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned, not just expansions or modifications to the existing plans. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the announcement only reaffirms or provides updates on the existing two-reactor plan, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will Russia not announce plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Russian government does not officially announce plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. The announcement must not come from an official government source, such as the Kremlin or Rosatom, and not be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The announcement must not clearly indicate an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned, and must not just reaffirm or provide updates on the existing two-reactor plan. If such an announcement is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Russia will declare intentions to construct more nuclear reactors in addition to the two currently in progress by July 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be considered TRUE if, by July 31, 2024, the Russian authorities make an official declaration regarding the construction of further nuclear reactors beyond the two that are presently planned. This declaration must originate from a recognized government entity, such as the Kremlin or Rosatom, and must be covered by at least two prominent international news organizations (for instance, Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The declaration must explicitly express a plan to build additional reactors beyond the two already in the works, rather than merely discussing expansions or alterations to the existing plans. If no such declaration occurs by the specified resolution date, or if the declaration only reiterates or updates the current two-reactor plan, the question will be answered as FALSE.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Russia reports a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024, and (b) Russia announces plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By August 31, 2024, Russia reports a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The success must be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). 'Successful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and barley being at least 5% above the five-year average. (2) By July 31, 2024, the Russian government officially announces plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. The announcement must come from an official government source, such as the Kremlin or Rosatom, and be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The announcement must clearly indicate an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned, not just expansions or modifications to the existing plans. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will not both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Russia does not report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024, or (b) Russia does not announce plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following conditions is met: (1) By August 31, 2024, Russia does not report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields not meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The lack of success must be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or fewer than three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). 'Unsuccessful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and barley being at least 5% below the five-year average. (2) By July 31, 2024, the Russian government does not officially announce plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. The lack of announcement must come from an official government source, such as the Kremlin or Rosatom, and not reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The announcement must not clearly indicate an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned, including just expansions or modifications to the existing plans. If either condition is met, the question resolves as YES.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) Russia will declare a successful winter harvest for wheat and barley by August 2024, and (b) Russia will reveal intentions to construct more nuclear reactors beyond the existing two?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied: (1) By August 31, 2024, Russia must announce a successful winter harvest for wheat and barley, defined by yields that meet or surpass the average of the last five years. This success must be validated by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or by at least three credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). 'Successful' is defined as the total production of wheat and barley being at least 5% greater than the five-year average. (2) By July 31, 2024, the Russian government must officially disclose plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the two currently in consideration. This announcement should originate from an official government entity, such as the Kremlin or Rosatom, and be reported by at least two major international news agencies (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The announcement must explicitly express an intention to build more reactors beyond the two already planned, rather than merely expanding or amending the current plans. If either criterion is unmet, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Indiana hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Indiana officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Indiana state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Indiana-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Indiana and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

not_P.title: Will Indiana not hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Indiana does not officially conduct a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must not be formally announced by the Indiana state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Indiana-based news outlets). The referendum must not be open to all eligible voters in Indiana and must not focus primarily on abortion rights. If such a referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is not canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

para_P.title: Will Indiana conduct a vote on abortion rights before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Indiana officially holds a statewide vote specifically regarding the inclusion of abortion rights in the state constitution. The vote must be formally declared by the Indiana state authorities and confirmed by at least two significant news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Indiana-based news sources). The vote must be accessible to all qualified voters in Indiana and primarily address abortion rights. If such a vote does not take place or is not finalized by the resolution date, or if the vote is canceled or delayed past July 31, 2024, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. It is important to note that this question only relates to the occurrence of the vote, not its result.

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a healthy behavior incentive by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a healthy behavior incentive for beneficiaries. The healthy behavior incentive must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will no other U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a healthy behavior incentive by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, no U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a healthy behavior incentive for beneficiaries. The healthy behavior incentive must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must not be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, nor consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must not be officially adopted, merely proposed or under consideration. If at least one other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for another U.S. state to implement a Medicaid program that includes an incentive for healthy behaviors by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state, aside from Georgia, formally implements a Medicaid program that features a healthy behavior incentive for its beneficiaries. The healthy behavior incentive must be an essential aspect of the program. For a positive outcome, there must be an official declaration from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent coverage from a minimum of two credible national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The program must be officially enacted, not simply suggested or being contemplated. If no other state enacts such a program by July 31, 2024, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

It must be open to all eligible voters in Indiana and focus primarily on abortion rights. (2) Another U.S. state adopts a Medicaid plan with a healthy behavior incentive: This will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan with a healthy behavior incentive for beneficiaries. There must be an official announcement from the state government or Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (AP, Reuters, NYT, or WP). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur by July 2024: (1) Indiana does not hold a referendum on abortion rights, or (2) another U.S. state does not adopt a Medicaid plan with a healthy behavior incentive?
not_P.body:

If such a referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if it is not canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO.

(2) Another U.S. state does not adopt a Medicaid plan with a healthy behavior incentive: This will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, no U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan with a healthy behavior incentive for beneficiaries. If any other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by July 2024, both of the following will take place: (1) Indiana conducts a referendum on abortion rights, and (2) another U.S. state implements a Medicaid plan that includes a healthy behavior incentive?
para_P.body:

It should be accessible to all eligible voters in Indiana and must primarily address abortion rights. (2) Another U.S. state implements a Medicaid plan with a healthy behavior incentive: This will be marked as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state, excluding Georgia, officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a healthy behavior incentive for its beneficiaries. The incentive must be an essential part of the plan. There must be an official announcement from the state government or Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two credible national news outlets (AP, Reuters, NYT, or WP). The plan must be officially adopted, rather than just proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, this part will be marked as NO.

question.title: Will the United Nations Development Programme announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official UNDP channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the United Nations Development Programme not announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme does not officially announce one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must not be made through official UNDP channels (such as their website or press releases) or not be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must not be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, or must be continuations of previously announced commitments. If such an announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments exceeds $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the United Nations Development Programme will declare new funding commitments surpassing $400 million by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, by July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme formally declares one or more new funding commitments that together exceed $400 million. The declarations must occur through official UNDP channels (like their website or press releases) and be covered by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments should represent new initiatives or substantial expansions of current programs, rather than extensions of previously announced commitments. If no such declarations are made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not go beyond $400 million, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will a major hospital system in France cancel over €250 million in medical debt by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in France, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, successfully cancels more than €250 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple regions. The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Le Monde, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is not completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is €250 million or less, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will a major hospital system in France not cancel over €250 million in medical debt by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in France, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, does not successfully cancel more than €250 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple regions. The cancellation must not be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Le Monde, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should not target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is €250 million or less, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will a significant healthcare provider in France eliminate more than €250 million in medical debt by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, a healthcare provider located in France, in partnership with a charitable organization, effectively cancels upwards of €250 million in medical debt for no fewer than 150,000 patients across various regions. The cancellation must be publicly announced by the healthcare provider or reported by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Le Monde, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt relief should focus on patients deemed financially disadvantaged or unable to afford payment. If the debt cancellation is not finalized or officially acknowledged by the designated date, or if the total amount canceled is €250 million or less, the inquiry will be resolved as NO.

The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Le Monde, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If either condition is not met by the specified dates, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The United Nations Development Programme announces new funding commitments totaling over $400 million, nor (b) A major hospital system in France cancels over €250 million in medical debt?

The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. (b) By August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in France, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, successfully cancels more than €250 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple regions. The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Le Monde, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If both conditions are met by the specified dates, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by August 2024, both of these events will take place: (a) The United Nations Development Programme reveals new funding pledges exceeding $400 million, and (b) A prominent hospital network in France eliminates over €250 million in medical debt?

The debt relief should focus on patients deemed financially vulnerable or unable to pay. If either of the conditions is not satisfied by the given deadlines, the question will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Pennsylvania is confirmed to have been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects. Confirmation must come from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within Pennsylvania. If the total amount of such grants awarded to Pennsylvania does not exceed $300 million by the specified date, or if there is insufficient evidence to confirm such an award, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will Pennsylvania not receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Pennsylvania is confirmed to have not been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects. Confirmation must come from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or not be reported by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must not be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within Pennsylvania. If the total amount of such grants awarded to Pennsylvania exceeds $300 million by the specified date, or if there is sufficient evidence to confirm such an award, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Pennsylvania obtain more than $300 million in federal funding for electric vehicle initiatives by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered TRUE if, by July 31, 2024, it is verified that the state of Pennsylvania has received in excess of $300 million in federal funding specifically allocated for electric vehicle production, assembly, or related projects. Verification must be provided by official U.S. government entities (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or reported by at least two prominent national news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding must be clearly earmarked for electric vehicle-related activities within Pennsylvania. If the total federal funding awarded to Pennsylvania does not surpass $300 million by the stated date, or if there is inadequate evidence to verify such an award, the inquiry will be deemed FALSE.

question.title: Will Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must not involve a substantial number of Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. workers (fewer than 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must not last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from both Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. and the involved union.
4. The resolution must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is not achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as YES.

para_P.title: Will Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. come to an agreement to end a significant workers' strike by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This question is answered with YES if Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. successfully negotiates with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For the answer to be deemed valid:

1. The strike must include a considerable number of Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. employees (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike should continue for a minimum duration of one week.
3. Confirmation of the resolution must come from official announcements from both Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. and the participating union.
4. The outcome must be covered by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no resolution that meets all these conditions is reached by the specified deadline, or if no major strike takes place, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024 and will Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES only if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024:

(a) Pennsylvania is confirmed to have been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects. Confirmation must come from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within Pennsylvania.

(b) Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. The strike must involve a substantial number of Nissan workers (at least 1,000 participants) and last for at least one week. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. and the involved union, and be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If either of these conditions is not met by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Pennsylvania not receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024 or will Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES only if at least one of the following conditions is not met by July 31, 2024:

(a) Pennsylvania is not confirmed to have been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects. Confirmation must not come from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must not be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within Pennsylvania.

(b) Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike. The strike must not involve a substantial number of Nissan workers (at least 1,000 participants) or must last for less than one week. The resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from both Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. and the involved union, and must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If both of these conditions are met by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Texas hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Texas officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on abortion rights. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address abortion rights, either proposing to enshrine protections or to restrict/ban abortion. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on abortion does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Texas not hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Texas does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on abortion rights. The referendum topic must not directly address abortion rights, either proposing to enshrine protections or to restrict/ban abortion. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on abortion does not qualify; it must not be a specific referendum on the issue. question.title: Will Google lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Google has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Google confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

question.title: Will the South African Reserve Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the South African Reserve Bank officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. question.title: Will the Shanghai Composite index reach or exceed 4,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Shanghai Composite index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. question.title: Will the Bank of Korea announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of Korea publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Bank of Korea and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the base rate, which is the Bank of Korea's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Bank of Korea not announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of Korea does not publicly announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. If such an announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Bank of Korea declare a decrease in its main interest rate by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the Bank of Korea makes a public declaration of a decrease in its main interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially issued by the Bank of Korea and covered by at least two credible financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The decrease must pertain to the base rate, which is the primary instrument used by the Bank of Korea to affect the economy. Merely suggesting or speculating about potential rate cuts does not meet the criteria; there must be a definitive announcement of an actual rate decrease. If no such declaration occurs by the specified date, the inquiry will be answered negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (1) the Shanghai Composite index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points, and (2) the Bank of Korea announces a reduction in its key interest rate?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The Shanghai Composite index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points at any point between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Shanghai Stock Exchange. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points. (2) The Bank of Korea publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Bank of Korea and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the base rate, which is the Bank of Korea's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If either of these conditions is not met by the specified dates, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in New York City by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in New York City, New York. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a New York City rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will Kamala Harris not announce her running mate at a rally in New York City by August 2024?
