The announcement must not be made by Harris herself during the rally and must not clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must not be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris makes such an announcement at a New York City rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris reveal her choice for running mate at a gathering in New York City before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris makes a public declaration of her running mate for the upcoming election during a gathering in New York City, New York. The announcement must be delivered by Harris herself at the gathering and must explicitly name the person selected as her running mate. The event and announcement need to be corroborated by at least two credible national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours following the gathering. If Harris fails to make such a declaration at a New York City event by the conclusion of August 2024, or if the announcement occurs through alternative channels or at a different venue, the inquiry will be resolved as negative.

question.title: Will Maryland hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Maryland officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Maryland state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Maryland-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Maryland and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

not_P.title: Will Maryland not hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?

The referendum must not be open to all eligible voters in Maryland and must not focus primarily on abortion rights. If such a referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is not canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. question.title: Will 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' be the highest-grossing R-rated movie by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' remains the highest-grossing R-rated movie worldwide, not accounting for inflation, as of August 31, 2024. The ranking must be based on total box office earnings reported by at least two reputable sources such as Box Office Mojo, Variety, or The Hollywood Reporter. If any other R-rated movie surpasses its earnings by this date, or if 'Kingsman: The Blue Blood' loses its top position at any point before the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, only theatrical releases are considered, excluding any streaming or VOD revenues.

question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the UK economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy enters a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can the UK economy steer clear of a recession by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy has not entered a recession. For the purposes of this inquiry, a recession is characterized as experiencing two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as documented by the UK's Office for National Statistics. Conversely, the inquiry will be answered with a NO if the UK economy undergoes two successive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

The question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) occur as specified.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil announce a new inflation target by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Brazil officially announces a new inflation target. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Brazil communication channel, such as a press release, monetary policy statement, or a public speech by the President of the Central Bank of Brazil. The announcement should explicitly state the new inflation target. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Brazil maintains the current inflation target, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil not announce a new inflation target by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Brazil does not officially announce a new inflation target. The announcement must not come from an official Central Bank of Brazil communication channel, such as a press release, monetary policy statement, or a public speech by the President of the Central Bank of Brazil. The announcement should not explicitly state the new inflation target. The announcement must not be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If such an announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Brazil does not maintain the current inflation target, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Brazil's Central Bank set a new inflation goal by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, Brazil's Central Bank formally sets a new inflation goal. The declaration must originate from an official communication channel of Brazil's Central Bank, such as a press release, a monetary policy statement, or a public address by the President of the Central Bank. The declaration should clearly specify the new inflation goal. Additionally, the announcement must be covered by at least two prominent financial news organizations (like Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be deemed valid. If no such declaration occurs by the designated date, or if Brazil's Central Bank continues with the existing inflation goal, the inquiry will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will the Global Fund announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Global Fund officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official Global Fund channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Global Fund not announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Global Fund does not officially announce one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must not be made through official Global Fund channels (such as their website or press releases) or not be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must not be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, and must be continuations of previously announced commitments. If such an announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments exceeds $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the Global Fund will reveal new funding pledges exceeding $400 million by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Global Fund formally discloses one or more new funding pledges that together surpass $400 million. The disclosures must occur via official Global Fund platforms (like their website or press announcements) and be covered by at least two credible media outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding pledges need to be new projects or significant enhancements of existing initiatives, rather than extensions of previously declared commitments. If no such disclosures occur by the resolution date, or if the aggregate of new funding pledges does not exceed $400 million, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Brazil officially announces a new inflation target through an official communication channel such as a press release, monetary policy statement, or a public speech by the President of the Central Bank of Brazil. question.title: Will Oregon receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Oregon is confirmed to have been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects. The vote must not specifically be about restricting cruise ship docking to weekdays only, and the result of the vote must not be confirmed by official city announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local Alaskan news outlets). If such a vote has taken place and does not result in approval of the weekday-only restriction, this part of the question will resolve as YES. (b) There are no credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in Canada specifically in response to the government's decision to change environmental policies. To qualify as 'large', the protests must not involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across Canada. The protests must not be explicitly linked to the issue of environmental policy changes. If such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the policy change is rescinded before causing such protests, this part of the question will resolve as YES.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) Ketchikan, Alaska, decides to limit cruise ship docking to weekdays only, and (b) significant protests arise in Canada due to changes in environmental policies?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the subsequent conditions are satisfied by July 31, 2024: (a) The city of Ketchikan, Alaska, conducts an official vote (either through the city council or a public referendum) regarding the limitation of cruise ship docking to weekdays only, and the result of this vote favors such a limitation. The vote must specifically address the limitation of cruise ship docking to weekdays only, rather than a general limitation on cruise ships. The result must be validated by official city announcements or reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local Alaskan news organizations). If such a vote does not occur, or if it takes place but does not result in approval of the weekday-only limitation, this aspect of the question will be answered as NO. Note that this aspect pertains to the vote itself, not the enforcement of the limitation. (b) There are credible reports from at least two major international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) regarding large protests in Canada specifically in reaction to the government's alterations in environmental policies. To be considered 'large', the protests must involve a minimum of 1,000 participants in a single event or multiple coordinated events totaling at least 1,000 participants across Canada. The protests must be directly associated with the issue of changes in environmental policies. If no such protests that meet these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the policy change is revoked before inciting such protests, this portion of the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made textiles through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made textiles. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

not_P.title: Will the United States not maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made textiles through August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States does not continue to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made textiles. The non-existence of the tariff or a reduction below 100% must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is maintained at 100% or increased at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

If the tariff is lowered to below 100% or entirely eliminated at any time up to and including August 31, 2024, the outcome will be NO. Temporary suspensions or exemptions of the tariff that are explicitly labeled as temporary and do not permanently change the 100% rate will not influence the resolution of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Zoom lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Zoom has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Zoom confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

The layoffs must not be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Zoom confirms a higher number of layoffs, or if such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Confirming that no layoffs occur or that layoffs do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a YES resolution.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, Zoom has officially acknowledged the termination of no fewer than 1,800 staff members as part of its reorganization plan centered around AI. Such acknowledgment must be derived from formal company statements, regulatory documents, or reports from at least two credible news outlets (like Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The terminations must be directly associated with the AI-focused reorganization plan that was revealed in 2023. If Zoom confirms a lesser number of terminations, or if no confirmation that meets these criteria is provided by the resolution date, the inquiry will be considered negative. Any partial terminations or staged implementations that do not achieve the 1,800 employee count by the resolution date will also lead to a negative outcome.

question.title: Will Kansas hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Kansas officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. The referendum must be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. For a YES resolution, the referendum must be officially announced by the Kansas state government and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will the Bank of Canada announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of Canada officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Canada communications, such as press releases, Governing Council statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the overnight rate, which is the Bank of Canada's primary tool for monetary policy.

para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) By July 31, 2024, Michigan officially declares the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid program. The work requirement pertains to the stipulation that beneficiaries must either work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. (2) The Bank of Canada officially proclaims a reduction in interest rates to take effect by August 31, 2024. This announcement must be validated by official communications from the Bank of Canada, such as press releases, Governing Council statements, or public addresses by Bank officials. It is important to note that the actual implementation date of the interest rate cut can occur after August 31, 2024, provided that the announcement itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the overnight rate, which is the primary instrument for the Bank of Canada's monetary policy. If either condition is not fulfilled by the respective resolution dates, the inquiry resolves as NO.

The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Board of Governors and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. question.title: Will Virginia's Medicaid plan with work requirements enroll at least 25,000 beneficiaries by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Virginia's Medicaid plan, which includes a work requirement, has enrolled at least 25,000 low-income residents. Enrollment figures must be confirmed by official state reports, the Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services, or at least three widely recognized news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The plan must maintain its work requirement feature throughout the period. If the enrollment is below 25,000 by the resolution date, or if the work requirement is removed from the plan, the question resolves as NO. In case of any legal challenges or federal interventions that significantly alter the plan's structure or implementation, the question will still resolve based on the enrollment numbers of the original plan or its closest equivalent.

question.title: Will Apple Inc. resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Apple Inc. reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Apple Inc. workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Apple Inc. and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Apple Inc. not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
not_P.body:

2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from both Apple Inc. and the involved union.
4. The resolution must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is not achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as YES.

question.title: Will Louisiana's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?

For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

question.title: Will Missouri conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Missouri.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Nigeria's Senate pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

If such a bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed that meets all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Bayer allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug by July 2024?

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations are spreading election misinformation. question.title: Will Colorado's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?

question.title: Will the United States report a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States officially reports a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). If a bumper harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either corn or soybeans) but not both, or if no bumper harvest is reported for either crop, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the United States not report a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States does not officially report a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans, indicating that either the yields are not significantly above average compared to the previous five-year average, or that no bumper harvest is reported for either crop. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. question.title: Will the Singapore Straits Times Index reach or exceed 4,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. The 4,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. If the index does not reach 4,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points.

question.title: Will Land O'Frost issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must not explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If such a recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, this part will resolve as YES.

The overall question will resolve as YES only if neither part (a) nor part (b) resolves as YES by the specified date.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by August 2024, both the following will happen: (a) The World Health Organization announces the end of the current West Nile virus outbreak, and (b) Land O'Frost issues a recall for deli meats due to a listeria outbreak?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a YES if both of the following events take place by August 31, 2024:

(a) The World Health Organization (WHO) formally states that the existing West Nile virus outbreak is over. This declaration must be validated through official WHO statements or reports from at least three credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak in question is the one that led to increased public health measures worldwide. If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO prolongs the emergency status past August 31, 2024, this component will conclude as NO.

(b) Land O'Frost makes a formal announcement regarding a recall of any of its deli meat items due to a listeria outbreak. This recall must be confirmed via at least one of the following sources:

1. An official statement on Land O'Frost's website or social media
2. A press release issued by Land O'Frost
3. A notification from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) that specifically references a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) quoting official sources

The recall must clearly state listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall that meets these criteria is announced by the specified date, this part will resolve as NO.

The overall inquiry will conclude with a YES only if both parts (a) and (b) conclude with a YES by the specified date.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage in the US fall below 5.0% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 5.0% at any point. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If the rate does not fall below 5.0% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac discontinues reporting this metric, the question will resolve as NO. For clarity, a rate of exactly 5.0% will not be considered as falling below 5.0%.

not_P.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage in the US not fall below 5.0% by August 2024?

question.title: Will Jerome Powell remain as Federal Reserve Chair through July 2024?

If he is no longer serving as Chair by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. question.title: Will Missouri hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Missouri officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Missouri state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Missouri-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Missouri and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

The referendum must not be open to all eligible voters in Missouri and must not focus primarily on abortion rights. If such a referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is not canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in Miami by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Miami, Florida. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a Miami rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will New Jersey conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of New Jersey.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a mental health support requirement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a mental health support requirement for beneficiaries. 2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If both of these conditions are met by their respective dates, the question will resolve as YES. If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Another U.S. state adopts a Medicaid plan with a mental health support requirement by July 2024 (b) Tennessee conducts a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following conditions are met:

(a) By July 31, 2024, no U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a mental health support requirement for beneficiaries. The mental health support requirement must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be no official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, and there must not be consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must not be officially adopted, nor merely proposed or under consideration.

(b) By August 31, 2024, Tennessee does not conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must not be met:

1. The referendum must not be officially announced and conducted by the state of Tennessee.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must not be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If neither of these conditions are met by their respective dates, the question will resolve as YES. If either condition is met, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of these events will take place: (a) Another U.S. state implements a Medicaid plan that mandates mental health support by July 2024 (b) Tennessee holds a vote on abortion rights by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled:

(a) By July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state, excluding Georgia, officially implements a Medicaid plan that incorporates a mental health support requirement for its beneficiaries. The mental health support requirement must be a fundamental aspect of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official declaration from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from a minimum of two credible national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially implemented, not simply proposed or under review.

(b) By August 31, 2024, Tennessee carries out a public vote specifically aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a YES resolution, the following conditions must be satisfied:

1. The vote must be officially announced and executed by the state of Tennessee.
2. The primary emphasis of the vote must be on safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The outcomes of the vote must be publicly disclosed by official state channels or widely respected news organizations.

If both of these criteria are satisfied by their respective deadlines, the inquiry will resolve as YES. If either criterion is not satisfied, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Iowa's 6-week abortion ban be overturned by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Iowa's law banning most abortions after approximately six weeks of pregnancy is either repealed by the state legislature or invalidated by a court ruling. The repeal or invalidation must be confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources. If the law remains in effect as of July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'overturned' means the law is no longer enforceable in its current form, either through legislative action or judicial decision.

not_P.title: Will Iowa's 6-week abortion ban not be overturned by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Iowa's law banning most abortions after approximately six weeks of pregnancy is not repealed by the state legislature and not invalidated by a court ruling. The repeal or invalidation must be confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources. If the law is still in effect as of July 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. For the purpose of this question, 'not overturned' means the law remains enforceable in its current form, either through legislative inaction or judicial decision.

para_P.title: Will Iowa's 6-week abortion restriction be annulled by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, by July 31, 2024, Iowa's statute prohibiting most abortions after roughly six weeks of gestation is either revoked by the state legislature or nullified by a court decision. The revocation or nullification must be substantiated by official state communications or reported by at least two credible news outlets. If the statute continues to be in effect as of July 31, 2024, the inquiry will be deemed NO. In the context of this question, 'annulled' signifies that the statute is no longer applicable in its current state, whether through legislative measures or judicial rulings.

question.title: Will Colorado's abortion law allowing procedures up to 22 weeks remain unchanged by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Colorado's current abortion law permitting abortions up to 22 weeks remains in effect without any changes. The status of the law must be confirmed by official state legislative records or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local Colorado newspapers). If the law is modified, replaced, or overturned by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. This includes any changes that either restrict or expand the current 22-week limit.

not_P.title: Will Colorado's abortion law allowing procedures up to 22 weeks be changed by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Colorado's current abortion law permitting abortions up to 22 weeks is modified, replaced, or overturned. The status of the law must be confirmed by official state legislative records or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local Colorado newspapers). If the law remains unchanged by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. This includes any changes that either restrict or expand the current 22-week limit.

para_P.title: Will the abortion regulations in Colorado that permit procedures up to 22 weeks stay the same by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, the existing abortion regulations in Colorado that allow abortions up to 22 weeks are still in place without any alterations. The law's status must be verified through official state legislative documentation or reported by a minimum of two major news organizations (like Associated Press, Reuters, or local Colorado media). If there are any modifications, replacements, or annulments of the law by the specified date, the answer will be NO. This encompasses any adjustments that either limit or broaden the current 22-week allowance.

The status of the law must be confirmed by official state legislative records or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local Colorado newspapers). If both conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

If either condition is met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Iowa's 6-week abortion restriction is nullified by July 2024 AND (b) Colorado's abortion regulation allowing procedures up to 22 weeks stays the same by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) By July 31, 2024, Iowa's statute prohibiting most abortions after around six weeks of pregnancy is either rescinded by the state legislature or struck down by a judicial ruling. question.title: Will a major social media platform be reported for spreading election misinformation through its AI systems by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a major social media platform is spreading election misinformation through its AI systems. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the platform and its AI systems' role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will a major social media platform not be reported for spreading election misinformation through its AI systems by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are no credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a major social media platform is spreading election misinformation through its AI systems. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the platform and its AI systems' role in spreading election misinformation. para_P.title: By August 2024, will there be credible allegations against a significant social media network for disseminating false information regarding elections via its AI technologies?

In this context, 'false information regarding elections' pertains to inaccurate or deceptive data about electoral procedures, candidates, or outcomes. Trustworthy allegations must originate from at least two of the following sources: state or federal electoral officials, major news organizations (like Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or leading US networks), or peer-reviewed research published in respected academic journals. The allegations or advisories must explicitly reference the network and the involvement of its AI technologies in the dissemination of false electoral information. If no such allegations or advisories are made by the specified resolution date, the inquiry will conclude with a NO.

question.title: Will Nicolas Maduro publicly condemn the attack on Maria Corina Machado's headquarters by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro makes a public statement specifically condemning the attack on Maria Corina Machado's headquarters that occurred in 2023. The statement must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or similar). The condemnation must be explicit and unambiguous, directly addressing the attack on Machado's headquarters. If no such condemnation is made by the resolution date, or if the condemnation is vague or does not specifically mention the attack on Machado's headquarters, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Nicolas Maduro not publicly condemn the attack on Maria Corina Machado's headquarters by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro does not make a public statement specifically condemning the attack on Maria Corina Machado's headquarters that occurred in 2023. The statement must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or similar). The condemnation must be vague or not directly address the attack on Machado's headquarters. If such a condemnation is made by the resolution date, or if the condemnation is explicit and unambiguous, directly addressing the attack on Machado's headquarters, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will Nicolas Maduro issue a public denunciation of the assault on Maria Corina Machado's office?

The denunciation must be clear and direct, specifically referring to the assault on Machado's office. If such a denunciation is not made by the resolution date, or if the denunciation is ambiguous or fails to specifically mention the assault on Machado's office, the question will be answered with a NO.

(2) Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro makes a public statement specifically condemning the attack on Maria Corina Machado's headquarters that occurred in 2023. The statement must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or similar). para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following two events take place: (1) A significant social media platform is accused of disseminating election-related falsehoods via its AI systems, and (2) Nicolas Maduro issues a public denunciation of the assault on Maria Corina Machado's office?

This declaration must be reported by at least two reliable international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or comparable). The condemnation must be clear and direct, specifically addressing the assault on Machado's office. If both criteria are not fulfilled by the resolution date, the inquiry will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India not announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India does not officially announce a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The lack of an announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The absence of an interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If such an official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Reserve Bank of India will declare a reduction in interest rates by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the Reserve Bank of India makes a formal announcement regarding a reduction in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be validated through official communications from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by a minimum of two major financial news outlets (like Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be an official decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and conveyed in their formal statement or press briefing after a meeting. Any conjecture about potential future rate cuts or unofficial remarks by individual members of the RBI will not be counted for resolution. If no such official declaration of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution deadline, the question will resolve as negative.

question.title: Will Oracle announce measures to reduce AI-related electricity consumption by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Oracle officially announces specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, blog posts, or annual reports) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The measures announced should be concrete steps or initiatives designed to decrease the energy usage of Oracle's AI systems. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announced measures do not specifically target AI-related electricity consumption, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Oracle not announce measures to reduce AI-related electricity consumption by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Oracle does not officially announce specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations. The announcement must not be made through official company channels (such as press releases, blog posts, or annual reports) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The measures announced should not be concrete steps or initiatives designed to decrease the energy usage of Oracle's AI systems. If such an announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announced measures specifically target AI-related electricity consumption, the question resolves as NO.

The declaration must come through official company channels (like press releases, blog entries, or annual reports) or be covered by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The strategies disclosed should consist of tangible actions or initiatives aimed at reducing the power consumption of Oracle's AI systems. If no such declaration is made by the given date, or if the disclosed strategies do not specifically address AI-related electricity usage, the inquiry will be deemed NO.

The decision must be made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. (b) Oracle officially announces specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations, through official company channels or reported by at least two major news outlets. The measures must be concrete steps or initiatives designed to decrease the energy usage of Oracle's AI systems. If either or both of these announcements are made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will California receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of California is confirmed to have been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects. Confirmation must come from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within California. If the total amount of such grants awarded to California does not exceed $300 million by the specified date, or if there is insufficient evidence to confirm such an award, the question will resolve as NO.

The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within California. If both conditions are met by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) President Biden gives a speech at a National Education Association gathering in Illinois, and (b) California secures more than $300 million in federal funding for electric vehicle initiatives?

question.title: Will a major hospital system in the Northeast US cancel over $300 million in medical debt by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in the Northeast United States, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, successfully cancels more than $300 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple Northeastern states. The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is not completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is $300 million or less, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will a major hospital system in the Northeast US not cancel over $300 million in medical debt by August 2024?

para_P.title: Is it possible for a significant healthcare provider in the Northeast US to eliminate more than $300 million in medical debt by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, a healthcare provider located in the Northeast United States, in partnership with a nonprofit organization, successfully eliminates over $300 million in medical debt for a minimum of 150,000 patients across various Northeastern states. The debt cancellation must be officially announced by the healthcare provider or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as the Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt relief should focus on patients deemed financially disadvantaged or unable to pay. If the debt relief is not completed or officially verified by the given date, or if the total amount canceled is $300 million or less, the inquiry will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will Hyundai Motor Company resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Hyundai Motor Company reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Hyundai Motor Company not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if Hyundai Motor Company does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must not involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (fewer than 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must not last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union.
4. The resolution must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if a significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Hyundai Motor Company come to an agreement to end a significant workers' strike by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with a YES if Hyundai Motor Company successfully negotiates with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For the answer to be deemed valid:

1. The strike must include a considerable number of workers from Hyundai Motor Company (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must persist for a minimum duration of one week.
3. The resolution must be verified through official announcements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the participating union.
4. The outcome must be reported by a minimum of two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no resolution meeting all these stipulations is reached by the given date, or if no significant strike takes place, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A major hospital system in the Northeast US cancels over $300 million in medical debt by August 2024, and (b) Hyundai Motor Company resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES only if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in the Northeast United States, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, cancels more than $300 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple Northeastern states. The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is not completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is $300 million or less, this condition is not met.

(b) Hyundai Motor Company reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid, the strike must involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (at least 1,000 participants), last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union. Additionally, the resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this condition is not met.

The question resolves as NO if either or both conditions are not met.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) A major hospital system in the Northeast US cancels over $300 million in medical debt by August 2024, nor (b) Hyundai Motor Company resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES only if neither of the following conditions are met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in the Northeast United States, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, does not cancel more than $300 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple Northeastern states. The cancellation must not be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should not target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is more than $300 million, this condition is met.

(b) Hyundai Motor Company does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered invalid, the strike must not involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (at least 1,000 participants), last for at least one week, and the resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union. Additionally, the resolution must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if a significant strike does occur, this condition is met.

The question resolves as YES if either or both conditions are met.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) A significant healthcare provider in the Northeastern United States eliminates over $300 million in medical debt by the end of August 2024, and (b) Hyundai Motor Company successfully concludes a major workers' strike by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES only if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied:

(a) By August 31, 2024, a healthcare provider located in the Northeast United States, in partnership with a nonprofit organization, forgives more than $300 million in medical debt affecting at least 150,000 patients across various Northeastern states. The debt forgiveness must be publicly declared by the healthcare provider or reported by a minimum of two prominent news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or leading national newspapers). The debt relief should focus on patients deemed financially disadvantaged or incapable of payment. If the debt forgiveness is not finalized or officially acknowledged by the designated date, or if the amount forgiven is $300 million or less, this criterion is not satisfied.

(b) Hyundai Motor Company negotiates a settlement with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the outcome to be regarded as valid, the strike must involve a considerable number of Hyundai Motor Company employees (at least 1,000 participants), persist for a minimum of one week, and the settlement must be corroborated by official announcements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the relevant union. Furthermore, the settlement must be covered by at least two credible international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If no such settlement fulfilling all these conditions is reached by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this criterion is not satisfied.

The inquiry will be answered with NO if either or both criteria are not fulfilled.

question.title: Will Virginia maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has reversed this decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

not_P.title: Will Virginia not maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has not reversed this decision, has not reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or has not reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

para_P.title: Will Virginia uphold its existing legal position regarding abortion access by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has neither overturned nor significantly modified its 2023 ruling that invalidated state laws imposing stricter regulations on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers and prohibited a commonly used second-trimester procedure. Conversely, the answer will be NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has reversed this ruling, reintroduced stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the prohibition on the second-trimester procedure. The determination will rely on official court rulings or reliable reports from at least three prominent news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, or The Washington Post).

question.title: Will the SEC announce completion of a major insider trading investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) officially announces the completion of its investigation into insider trading practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official SEC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the SEC does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the SEC not announce completion of a major insider trading investigation by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) does not officially announce the completion of its investigation into insider trading practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must not be confirmed through an official SEC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the SEC does announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the SEC declare that a significant insider trading investigation has been concluded?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) publicly states that its investigation into insider trading activities involving at least five prominent companies has been finalized. The conclusion must be validated via an official SEC statement or reported by a minimum of two major news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the SEC fails to announce the closure of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation remains active, the resolution will be negative.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Australia announce a new fiscal policy initiative by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Australia officially announces a new fiscal policy initiative. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Australia communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Australia. The announcement should explicitly describe the new fiscal policy initiative. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Australia does not announce a new fiscal policy initiative, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Central Bank of Australia not announce a new fiscal policy initiative by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Australia does not officially announce a new fiscal policy initiative. The announcement should explicitly describe the new fiscal policy initiative. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If such an announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Australia announces a new fiscal policy initiative, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the Reserve Bank of Australia will declare a new economic policy measure before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Reserve Bank of Australia publicly declares a new economic policy measure. The declaration must originate from an official communication channel of the Reserve Bank of Australia, such as a press release or a public address by the Governor of the Reserve Bank of Australia. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the SEC announce completion of a major insider trading investigation by July 2024 and (b) the Central Bank of Australia announce a new fiscal policy initiative by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) officially announces the completion of its investigation into insider trading practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official SEC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). The announcement should explicitly describe the new fiscal policy initiative. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Australia does not announce a new fiscal policy initiative, this part resolves as NO. The combined question resolves as YES only if both parts (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) the SEC will declare the conclusion of a significant insider trading inquiry by July 2024 and (b) the Central Bank of Australia will introduce a new fiscal policy initiative by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered TRUE if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) By July 31, 2024, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) officially declares the conclusion of its investigation into insider trading activities involving at least five prominent companies. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Australia does not reveal a new fiscal policy initiative, this segment will be deemed FALSE. question.title: Will IBM lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, IBM has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If IBM confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

not_P.title: Will IBM not lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, IBM has not confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must not come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must not be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If IBM confirms a higher number of layoffs, or if such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Any layoffs or phased implementations that reach or exceed the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is it true that IBM will terminate a minimum of 1,800 employees by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, IBM has officially acknowledged the termination of at least 1,800 employees as part of its reorganization strategy focused on AI. Confirmation must be derived from official announcements by the company, regulatory submissions, or reports from a minimum of two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be directly associated with the AI-centric reorganization plan disclosed in 2023. If IBM verifies a lesser number of terminations, or if no confirmation fulfilling these criteria is provided by the resolution date, the question will be answered as NO. Any partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not achieve the 1,800 employee count by the resolution date will also lead to a NO outcome.

question.title: Will Tiff Macklem remain as Governor of the Bank of Canada through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Tiff Macklem is still serving as the Governor of the Bank of Canada on July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of Canada announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer serving as Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. Confirmation must be derived from official announcements from the Bank of Canada or reported by at least two significant news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg).
