question.title: Will Georgia hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Georgia conducts an official public referendum specifically focused on healthcare reform in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Georgia.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on healthcare reform.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum occurs or is completed by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Proposed referendums that have not been officially conducted by the resolution date do not count for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Chile announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Chile publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Central Bank of Chile and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Chile's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will U.S. previously occupied home sales show a decline for two consecutive months by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are two consecutive months where sales of previously occupied homes in the U.S. show a decline compared to the previous month. The data must be verified by reputable sources such as the National Association of Realtors or other widely recognized real estate market analysts. The declines must be reported in terms of seasonally adjusted annual rates. If no such consecutive monthly declines are reported by the resolution date, or if only a single month shows a decline, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will the World Health Organization not declare the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) does not officially declare the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern. If such a declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO does not extend the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will the World Health Organization announce the conclusion of the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) formally states that the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak has concluded by August 31, 2024. The confirmation must come from official WHO statements or reports from a minimum of three credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak in question is the one that led the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern. If no declaration is made to end the outbreak by the resolution date, or if the WHO prolongs the emergency status past August 31, 2024, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will the Bahraini health ministry confirm more than one case of polio in Manama by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Bahraini health ministry officially confirms more than one case of polio in Manama. For the purpose of this question:

1. Confirmation must come from official Bahraini health ministry reports or statements.
2. The confirmation must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera).
3. The cases must be new and separate from any cases reported before October 1, 2023.
4. Only cases within the geographical boundaries of Manama will be considered.
5. The type of polio (wild poliovirus or vaccine-derived poliovirus) does not matter for this question.

If no additional cases beyond the first are confirmed by the specified date, or if only one case in total is confirmed, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Bahraini health ministry confirm no more than one case of polio in Manama by August 2024?
not_P.body:

2. The confirmation must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera).
3. The cases must be new and separate from any cases reported before October 1, 2023.
4. Only cases within the geographical boundaries of Manama will be considered.
5. The type of polio (wild poliovirus or vaccine-derived poliovirus) does not matter for this question.

If more than one additional case beyond the first is confirmed by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the Bahraini health ministry to verify more than one instance of polio in Manama by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if, by August 31, 2024, the Bahraini health ministry officially verifies more than one instance of polio in Manama. For the sake of this inquiry:

1. Verification must come from official reports or statements issued by the Bahraini health ministry.
2. The verification must be covered by a minimum of two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera).
3. The instances must be new and distinct from any cases reported prior to October 1, 2023.
4. Only instances occurring within the geographical limits of Manama will be taken into account.
5. The specific type of polio (whether wild poliovirus or vaccine-derived poliovirus) is irrelevant for this inquiry.

If no further instances beyond the first are verified by the specified date, or if only one instance in total is verified, the inquiry will be considered FALSE.

question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur by August 31, 2024:

(a) The World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, this part of the question will resolve as NO.

(b) The Bahraini health ministry officially confirms more than one case of polio in Manama. Confirmation must come from official Bahraini health ministry reports or statements and be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera). The cases must be new and separate from any cases reported before October 1, 2023, and only cases within the geographical boundaries of Manama will be considered. The type of polio (wild poliovirus or vaccine-derived poliovirus) does not matter for this question. If no additional cases beyond the first are confirmed by the specified date, or if only one case in total is confirmed, this part of the question will resolve as NO.

The combined question will resolve as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will the Indian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indian economy does not enter a recession. question.title: Will Indiana conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Indiana.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

If Harris fails to make this announcement at a Charlotte rally by the conclusion of August 2024, or if the announcement occurs through different channels or at another venue, the question will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will Minnesota hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Minnesota officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Minnesota state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

not_P.title: Will Minnesota not hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?

2. The referendum must not explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. A referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is not cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held that specifically focuses on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it does not take place within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Minnesota will conduct a referendum regarding abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:

1. The referendum must be officially declared and executed by the Minnesota state authorities.

The inquiry will be marked as negative if:

1. No such referendum takes place by August 31, 2024.
2. A scheduled referendum is either cancelled or delayed beyond the given date.
3. A referendum occurs, but it does not specifically target the establishment of abortion rights protections.

Note: This question is concerned solely with the occurrence of the referendum, not its results within the designated timeframe.

The question will resolve as NO if one or both of these events do not occur by the specified date.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) Kamala Harris reveals her choice for running mate at a rally in Charlotte, and (b) Minnesota holds a vote on abortion rights?

question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the UK economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can the UK economy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy has not entered a recession. A recession is characterized in this context as experiencing two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The answer will be NO if the UK economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will PepsiCo report increased North American demand for its beverage products by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its beverage products compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If no such increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports continued decline or stagnation in demand for its beverage products in North America, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will PepsiCo not report increased North American demand for its beverage products by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo does not report an increase in North American demand for its beverage products compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The lack of increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should not be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If such an increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports an increase in demand for its beverage products in North America, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will there be a rise in North American demand for PepsiCo's beverage offerings by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo indicates a rise in North American demand for its beverage offerings compared to the demand noted in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be validated through official earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by no fewer than two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly mentioned or clearly suggested in the company's financial results or official communications. If such an increase is not reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo indicates a continued decline or stagnation in demand for its beverage offerings in North America, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by July 2024: (a) the UK economy avoids a recession and (b) PepsiCo reports increased North American demand for its beverage products?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The UK economy does not enter a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics, between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its beverage products compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023, confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by July 2024: (a) the UK economy enters a recession or (b) PepsiCo reports decreased North American demand for its beverage products?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if neither of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) The UK economy enters a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics, between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) PepsiCo reports a decrease in North American demand for its beverage products compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023, confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal. If either condition is met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) the UK economy successfully avoids a recession and (b) PepsiCo sees a rise in demand for its drinks in North America?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied by July 31, 2024: (a) The UK economy does not fall into a recession, which is characterized as experiencing two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics, occurring between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) PepsiCo experiences an uptick in North American demand for its beverage offerings in comparison to the demand noted in the second quarter of 2023, validated through official earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and corroborated by at least two credible news outlets like Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal. If either of these criteria is not fulfilled, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Illinois hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

not_P.title: Will Illinois not hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must not be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must not be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must not directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if such a referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must not be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Illinois will conduct a public vote on healthcare reform before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially carries out a public vote specifically aimed at implementing healthcare reform in the state. The vote must be formally declared by the Illinois Secretary of State or another relevant state election authority, and it must be set to occur on or before August 31, 2024. The question posed in the vote must directly relate to the topic of healthcare reform. This inquiry will be deemed FALSE if no such vote is officially declared or conducted by the given date. It is important to note that simply collecting signatures for a potential vote does not meet the criteria for a TRUE resolution; the actual vote must be scheduled or held within the designated timeframe.

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a health savings account requirement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a health savings account requirement for beneficiaries. The health savings account requirement must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will no other U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan without a health savings account requirement by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, no U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a health savings account requirement for beneficiaries. The plan must be officially enacted, not just suggested or being evaluated. If no other state enacts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the inquiry will resolve as negative.

question.title: Will Rome announce plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the city government of Rome officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units (such as those typically listed on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. The announcement must come from an official source within Rome's local government and be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The restrictions or regulations should be specifically targeted at reducing the number of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering the way they operate. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such official announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the European Central Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank officially announces a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 30-year mortgage exceed 7.0% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 7.0%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 7.0% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 7.0%, not merely equal it.

not_P.title: Will the average rate on a 30-year mortgage not exceed 7.0% by August 2024?

para_P.title: Will the typical interest rate for a 30-year mortgage surpass 7.0% by August 2024?

If the rate does not go beyond 7.0% at any time during August 2024, the answer will be NO. To clarify, the rate must exceed 7.0%, not just meet it.

question.title: Will Massachusetts maintain its $15 per hour minimum wage for fast food workers through July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, as of July 31, 2024, the minimum wage for fast food workers in Massachusetts remains at $15 per hour or higher. The wage must be confirmed through official Massachusetts state announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). If the wage is reduced below $15 per hour at any point by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'fast food workers' refers to employees in fast food restaurants as defined by Massachusetts state law.

not_P.title: Will Massachusetts not maintain its $15 per hour minimum wage for fast food workers through July 2024?

para_P.title: Will the $15 hourly minimum wage for fast food employees in Massachusetts be upheld until July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, on July 31, 2024, the minimum wage for fast food employees in Massachusetts is still set at $15 per hour or more. question.title: Will Florida hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Florida officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Florida state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) A new AI platform is reported for spreading election misinformation and (b) Bloomberg Philanthropies announces a $600 million donation to Hispanic-serving universities?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

(a) There are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a new AI platform is spreading election misinformation. 'Election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the new AI platform and its role in spreading election misinformation.

(b) Bloomberg Philanthropies officially announces a donation of $600 million to the endowments of Hispanic-serving universities. The announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers) or through official statements from Bloomberg Philanthropies or the recipient institutions. The donation must be specifically intended for the endowments of these universities.

If either (a) or (b) does not occur by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by August 2024: (a) A new AI platform is reported for spreading election misinformation nor (b) Bloomberg Philanthropies announces a $600 million donation to Hispanic-serving universities?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

(a) There are no credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a new AI platform is spreading election misinformation. 'Election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should not come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must not specifically mention the new AI platform and its role in spreading election misinformation.

(b) Bloomberg Philanthropies does not officially announce a donation of $600 million to the endowments of Hispanic-serving universities. The announcement must not be confirmed by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers) or through official statements from Bloomberg Philanthropies or the recipient institutions. The donation must not be specifically intended for the endowments of these universities.

If either (a) or (b) does occur by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will there be evidence of both: (a) Reports of a new AI platform disseminating election misinformation and (b) An official announcement from Bloomberg Philanthropies regarding a $600 million contribution to universities serving Hispanic students?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied by August 31, 2024:

(a) There exist credible accounts or formal alerts from election authorities, governmental bodies, or trustworthy news organizations indicating that a new AI platform is involved in spreading election misinformation. 'Election misinformation' is defined as inaccurate or deceptive information concerning election procedures, candidates, or outcomes. Credible accounts should originate from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, leading news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed research published in respected journals. The accounts or alerts must explicitly reference the new AI platform and its involvement in the dissemination of election misinformation.

(b) Bloomberg Philanthropies makes an official declaration of a $600 million donation aimed at the endowments of universities that serve Hispanic students. This declaration must be verified by at least two reliable news outlets (like Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers) or through official communications from Bloomberg Philanthropies or the recipient institutions. The donation must be specifically designated for the endowments of these universities.

If either (a) or (b) fails to take place by the resolution date, the inquiry will conclude with a NO.

question.title: Will the South Korean economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the South Korean economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Korea. The question resolves as NO if the South Korean economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the South Korean economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the South Korean economy enters a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Korea. The question resolves as NO if the South Korean economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can South Korea steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, the South Korean economy has not entered a recession. A recession is characterized for this question as two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as reported by Statistics Korea. The outcome will be negative if the South Korean economy faces two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the WHO declare the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak, not a global Lassa fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Lassa fever that does not specifically address the Nigerian outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the WHO not declare the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria a global emergency by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) does not officially declare that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is still considered a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak, not a global Lassa fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO makes such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Lassa fever that specifically addresses the Nigerian outbreak and states it is no longer a global emergency.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the WHO will announce the Lassa fever situation in Nigeria is no longer a global emergency by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) publicly states that the Lassa fever situation in Nigeria is no longer deemed a global emergency. For a YES outcome:

1. The WHO must issue a public statement clearly indicating that the Lassa fever situation in Nigeria is no longer regarded as a global emergency.
2. This announcement must be covered by at least two prominent international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The statement must specifically mention the Lassa fever situation in Nigeria, not a worldwide Lassa fever context in general.

The inquiry will be answered with a NO if:
1. The WHO does not issue such a statement by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a statement regarding Lassa fever that does not specifically mention the Nigerian situation.
3. The WHO continues or intensifies the emergency designation of the Nigerian Lassa fever situation.

Note: If the WHO has previously declared the Nigerian Lassa fever situation as no longer a global emergency before the start date of this inquiry, the resolution will still be based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The South Korean economy avoids a recession by July 2024, and (b) The WHO declares the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By July 31, 2024, the South Korean economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Korea. The question resolves as NO if the South Korean economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

(b) By August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:
   1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer a global emergency.
   2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
   3. The declaration must specifically refer to the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak, not a global Lassa fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if either:
(a) The South Korean economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.
(b) The WHO does not make the required declaration by August 31, 2024, or makes a declaration about Lassa fever that does not specifically address the Nigerian outbreak, or maintains or escalates the emergency status of the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The South Korean economy avoids a recession by July 2024, nor (b) The WHO declares the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if neither of the following conditions are met:

(a) By July 31, 2024, the South Korean economy enters a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Korea. The question resolves as NO if the South Korean economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

(b) By August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) does not officially declare that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:
   1. The WHO must not make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer a global emergency.
   2. This declaration must not be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
   3. The declaration must not specifically refer to the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak, but rather a global Lassa fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if either:
(a) The South Korean economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.
(b) The WHO makes the required declaration by August 31, 2024, or makes a declaration about Lassa fever that specifically addresses the Nigerian outbreak, or maintains or escalates the emergency status of the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has not already declared the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) The South Korean economy remains free from recession by July 2024, and (b) The WHO announces the Lassa fever situation in Nigeria is no longer deemed a global emergency by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will result in a YES if both of these criteria are fulfilled:

(a) By July 31, 2024, the South Korean economy does not fall into a recession. For the context of this inquiry, a recession is defined as experiencing two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Korea. This inquiry will result in a NO if the South Korean economy faces two successive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

(b) By August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially states that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer classified as a global emergency. For a YES resolution:
   1. The WHO must issue a public statement clearly indicating that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer considered a global emergency.
   2. This statement must be covered by at least two prominent international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
   3. The statement must specifically mention the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak, rather than a general global Lassa fever situation.

The inquiry will resolve as NO if either:
(a) The South Korean economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.
(b) The WHO fails to issue the necessary statement by August 31, 2024, or makes a statement regarding Lassa fever that does not specifically pertain to the Nigerian outbreak, or continues or heightens the emergency status of the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak no longer a global emergency before the start date of this inquiry, the resolution will still be based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the Singapore Straits Times Index reach or exceed 4,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. The 4,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. If the index does not reach 4,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points.

not_P.title: Will the Singapore Straits Times Index not reach or exceed 4,000 points by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at no point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. The 4,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. If the index reaches 4,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points.

para_P.title: Will the Singapore Straits Times Index hit or surpass 4,000 points before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, at any time from October 1, 2023 to August 31, 2024, the Singapore Straits Times Index hits or surpasses 4,000 points. The 4,000 point threshold is selected as a significant marker that the index may have previously reached prior to a major decline. Confirmation will rely on official index reports from trustworthy financial market data sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. If the index does not achieve 4,000 points within this timeframe, the answer will be NO. It is important to note that intraday peaks are considered for resolution; the index is not required to close at or above 4,000 points.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current bird flu outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing bird flu outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will the World Health Organization not declare the current bird flu outbreak over by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) does not officially declare the ongoing bird flu outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from fewer than three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If such a declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO does not extend the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will the World Health Organization announce the conclusion of the current avian influenza outbreak by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) formally states that the present avian influenza outbreak is over by August 31, 2024. The confirmation of this declaration must come from official announcements or reports from at least three credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak in question is the one that led to increased global public health measures. If such a declaration is not made by the resolution date, or if the WHO prolongs the emergency status past August 31, 2024, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points, and (b) The World Health Organization declares the current bird flu outbreak over?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points at any time between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024. This includes intraday highs, based on official reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. (b) The World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing bird flu outbreak over by August 31, 2024, as confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC. If either condition is not met, this question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The Singapore Straits Times Index does not reach or exceed 4,000 points, or (b) The World Health Organization does not declare the current bird flu outbreak over?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) The Singapore Straits Times Index does not reach or exceed 4,000 points at any time between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024. This includes intraday highs, based on official reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. (b) The World Health Organization (WHO) does not officially declare the ongoing bird flu outbreak over by August 31, 2024, as confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC. If both conditions are met, this question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) The Singapore Straits Times Index hits or surpasses 4,000 points, and (b) The World Health Organization announces the conclusion of the current bird flu outbreak?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) The Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points at any point between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024. This encompasses intraday peaks, based on official data from reliable financial market information providers like Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. (b) The World Health Organization (WHO) formally declares the present bird flu outbreak to be over by August 31, 2024, as verified through official WHO statements or reports from a minimum of three credible news organizations such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC. If either criterion is not satisfied, this inquiry will be resolved as NO.
